   20: -module(global_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Prior to OTP 26, maybe_expr used to require runtime support. As it's now
   23: %% enabled by default, all modules are tagged with the feature even when they
   24: %% don't use it. Therefore, we explicitly disable it until OTP 25 is out of
   25: %% support.
   26: -feature(maybe_expr, disable).
   27: -compile(r24). % many_nodes()
   28: 
   29: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, 
   30: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   31:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   32:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   33: 
   34: 	 names/1, names_hidden/1, locks/1, locks_hidden/1,
   35: 	 bad_input/1, names_and_locks/1, lock_die/1, name_die/1,
   36: 	 basic_partition/1, basic_name_partition/1,
   37: 	 advanced_partition/1, stress_partition/1,
   38: 	 ring/1, simple_ring/1, line/1, simple_line/1,
   39: 	 global_lost_nodes/1, otp_1849/1,
   40: 	 otp_3162/1, otp_5640/1, otp_5737/1,
   41:          connect_all_false/1, 
   42:          simple_disconnect/1, 
   43:          simple_resolve/1, simple_resolve2/1, simple_resolve3/1,
   44:          leftover_name/1, re_register_name/1, name_exit/1, external_nodes/1,
   45:          many_nodes/1, sync_0/1,
   46: 	 global_groups_change/1,
   47: 	 register_1/1,
   48: 	 both_known_1/1,
   49:          lost_unregister/1,
   50: 	 mass_death/1,
   51: 	 garbage_messages/1,
   52:          ring_line/1,
   53:          flaw1/1,
   54:          lost_connection/1,
   55:          lost_connection2/1,
   56:          global_disconnect/1
   57:         ]).
   58: 
   59: %% Not used
   60: -export([config_dc/4,
   61:          w/2,
   62:          check_same/2,
   63:          check_same/1,
   64:          stop/0,
   65:          start_nodes_serially/3]).
   66: 
   67: -export([lock_global/2, lock_global2/2]).
   68: 
   69: -export([
   70:          %% Called via ?RES
   71:          resolve_none/3,
   72:          resolve_first/3,
   73:          resolve_second/3,
   74:          bad_resolver/3,
   75:          badrpc_resolver/3,
   76:          lock_resolver/3,
   77:          exit_resolver/3,
   78:          disconnect_first/3,
   79:          halt_second/3,
   80:          init_mass_spawn/1,
   81: 
   82:          %% Called via rpc_cast
   83:          crash/1,
   84:          single_node/2,
   85:          alone/2,
   86:          global_load/3,
   87: 
   88:          %% Called via rpc:call
   89:          halt_node/1,
   90:          start_proc/0, start_proc/1,
   91:          start_proc2/1,
   92:          start_proc3/1,
   93:          start_proc4/1,
   94:          start_proc_basic/1,
   95:          start_resolver/2,
   96: 
   97:          %% Called as a fun (fun ?MODULE:function/x) 
   98:          fix_basic_name/3,
   99: 
  100:          %% Called via spawn
  101:          init_proc_basic/2,
  102:          init_2/0,
  103:          p_init/1, p_init/2,
  104:          p_init2/2
  105: 
  106:         ]).
  107: 
  108: -export([start_tracer/0, stop_tracer/0, get_trace/0]).
  109: 
  110: %% Exports for error_logger handler
  111: -export([init/1, handle_event/2, handle_info/2, handle_call/2, terminate/2]).
  112: 
  113: 
  114: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
  115: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
  116: 
  117: -define(NODES, [node()|nodes()]).
  118: 
  119: -define(UNTIL(Seq), loop_until_true(fun() -> Seq end, Config, 1)).
  120: 
  121: %% The resource used by the global module.
  122: -define(GLOBAL_LOCK, global).
  123: 
  124: %% -define(DBG(T), erlang:display({{self(), ?MODULE, ?LINE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, T})).
  125: 
  126: 
  127: suite() ->
  128:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  129: 
  130: all() -> 
  131:     case init:get_argument(ring_line) of
  132: 	{ok, _} -> [ring_line];
  133: 	_ ->
  134: 	    [
  135:              names, names_hidden, locks, locks_hidden, bad_input,
  136: 	     names_and_locks, lock_die, name_die, basic_partition,
  137: 	     advanced_partition, basic_name_partition,
  138: 	     stress_partition, simple_ring, simple_line, ring, line,
  139: 	     global_lost_nodes, otp_1849, otp_3162, otp_5640,
  140: 	     otp_5737, connect_all_false, simple_disconnect, simple_resolve,
  141: 	     simple_resolve2, simple_resolve3, leftover_name,
  142: 	     re_register_name, name_exit, external_nodes, many_nodes,
  143: 	     sync_0, global_groups_change, register_1, both_known_1,
  144: 	     lost_unregister, mass_death, garbage_messages, flaw1,
  145:              lost_connection, lost_connection2, global_disconnect
  146:             ]
  147:     end.
  148: 
  149: groups() -> 
  150:     [{ttt, [],
  151:       [names, names_hidden, locks, locks_hidden, bad_input,
  152:        names_and_locks, lock_die, name_die, basic_partition,
  153:        ring]}].
  154: 
  155: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  156:     Config.
  157: 
  158: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  159:     Config.
  160: 
  161: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  162:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
  163:     Config.
  164: 
  165: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  166:     ok.
  167: 
  168: 
  169: -define(TESTCASE, testcase_name).
  170: -define(testcase, proplists:get_value(?TESTCASE, Config)).
  171: -define(nodes_tag, '$global_nodes').
  172: -define(registered, proplists:get_value(registered, Config)).
  173: 
  174: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) when is_atom(Case) andalso is_list(Config0) ->
  175:     start_node_tracker(Config0),
  176: 
  177:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  178:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  179:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  180:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  181:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  182:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  183: 
  184:     ok = gen_server:call(global_name_server,
  185:                          high_level_trace_start,
  186:                          infinity),
  187: 
  188:     Config1 = [{?TESTCASE, Case}, {registered, registered()} | Config0],
  189: 
  190:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  191:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  192:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  193:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  194:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [Config1, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  195: 
  196:     Config1.
  197: 
  198: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  199:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  200:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  201:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  202:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  203:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  204:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  205: 
  206:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  207:     _ = gen_server:call(global_name_server, high_level_trace_stop, infinity),
  208:     [global:unregister_name(N) || N <- global:registered_names()],
  209:     InitRegistered = ?registered,
  210:     Registered = registered(),
  211: 
  212:     [?P("end_per_testcase -> "
  213:         "~n   ~s local names: ~p", [What, N]) ||
  214: 	{What, N} <- [{"Added", Registered -- InitRegistered},
  215: 		      {"Removed", InitRegistered -- Registered}],
  216: 	N =/= []],
  217: 
  218:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  219:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  220:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  221:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  222:        [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  223: 
  224:     stop_node_tracker(Config). %% Needs to be last and produce return value...
  225: 
  226: %%% General comments:
  227: %%% One source of problems with failing tests can be that the nodes from the
  228: %%% previous test haven't died yet.
  229: %%% So, when stressing a particular test by running it in a loop, it may
  230: %%% fail already when starting the help nodes, even if the nodes have been
  231: %%% monitored and the nodedowns picked up at the previous round. Waiting
  232: %%% a few seconds between rounds seems to solve the problem. Possibly the
  233: %%% timeout of 7 seconds for connections can also be a problem. This problem
  234: %%% is the same with old (vsn 3) and new global (vsn 4).
  235: 
  236: 
  237: %%% Test that register_name/2 registers the name on all nodes, even if
  238: %%% a new node appears in the middle of the operation (OTP-3552).
  239: %%%
  240: %%% Test scenario: process p2 is spawned, locks global, starts a slave node,
  241: %%% and tells the parent to do register_name. Then p2 sleeps for five seconds
  242: %%% and releases the lock. Now the name should exist on both our own node
  243: %%% and on the slave node (we wait until that is true; it seems that we
  244: %%% can do rpc calls to another node before the connection is really up).
  245: register_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  246:     Timeout = 15,
  247:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  248:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  249:     init_condition(Config),
  250:     P = spawn_link(?MODULE, lock_global, [self(), Config]),
  251:     receive
  252: 	{P, ok} ->
  253: 	    io:format("p1: received ok~n"),
  254: 	    ok
  255:     end,
  256:     P ! step2,
  257:     io:format("p1: sent step2~n"),
  258:     yes = global:register_name(foo, self()),
  259:     io:format("p1: registered~n"),
  260:     P ! step3,
  261:     receive
  262: 	{P, I, I2} ->
  263: 	    ok
  264:     end,
  265:     if
  266: 	I =:= I2 ->
  267: 	    ok;
  268: 	true ->
  269: 	    ct:fail({notsync, I, I2})
  270:     end,
  271:     _ = global:unregister_name(foo),
  272:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  273:     init_condition(Config),
  274:     ok.
  275: 
  276: lock_global(Parent, Config) ->
  277:     Id = {global, self()},
  278:     io:format("p2: setting lock~n"),
  279:     global:set_lock(Id, [node()]),
  280:     Parent ! {self(), ok},
  281:     io:format("p2: sent ok~n"),
  282:     receive
  283: 	step2 ->
  284: 	    io:format("p2: received step2"),
  285: 	    ok
  286:     end,
  287:     io:format("p2: starting slave~n"),
  288:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  289:     {ok, N1} = slave:start(Host, node1),
  290:     io:format("p2: deleting lock~n"),
  291:     global:del_lock(Id, [node()]),
  292:     io:format("p2: deleted lock~n"),
  293:     receive
  294: 	step3 ->
  295: 	    ok
  296:     end,
  297:     io:format("p2: received step3~n"),
  298:     I = global:whereis_name(foo),
  299:     io:format("p2: name ~p~n", [I]),
  300:     ?UNTIL(I =:= rpc:call(N1, global, whereis_name, [foo])),
  301:     I2 = I,
  302:     slave:stop(N1),
  303:     io:format("p2: name2 ~p~n", [I2]),
  304:     Parent ! {self(), I, I2},
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: %%% Test for the OTP-3576 problem: if nodes 1 and 2 are separated and
  308: %%% brought together again, while keeping connection with 3, it could
  309: %%% happen that if someone temporarily held the 'global' lock,
  310: %%% 'try_again_locker' would be called, and this time cause both 1 and 2
  311: %%% to obtain a lock for 'global' on node 3, which would keep the
  312: %%% name registry from ever becoming consistent again.
  313: both_known_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  315:         true ->
  316:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions enabled"};
  317:         false ->
  318:             both_known_1_test(Config)
  319:     end.
  320: 
  321: both_known_1_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     Timeout = 30,
  323:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  324:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  325:     init_condition(Config),
  326: 
  327:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  328: 
  329:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], slave, Config),
  330: 
  331:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  332: 
  333:     rpc_disconnect_node(Cp1, Cp2, Config),
  334: 
  335:     {_Pid1, yes} = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, [p1]),
  336:     {_Pid2, yes} = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, [p2]),
  337: 
  338:     Names10 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  339:     Names20 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  340:     Names30 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  341: 
  342:     Names1 = Names10 -- OrigNames,
  343:     Names2 = Names20 -- OrigNames,
  344:     Names3 = Names30 -- OrigNames,
  345: 
  346:     [p1] = lists:sort(Names1),
  347:     [p2] = lists:sort(Names2),
  348:     [p1, p2] = lists:sort(Names3),
  349: 
  350:     Locker = spawn(Cp3, ?MODULE, lock_global2, [{global, l3},
  351: 						self()]),
  352: 
  353:     receive
  354: 	{locked, S} ->
  355: 	    true = S
  356:     end,
  357: 
  358:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
  359: 
  360:     %% Bring cp1 and cp2 together, while someone has locked global.
  361:     %% They will now loop in 'loop_locker'.
  362: 
  363:     Names10_2 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  364:     Names20_2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  365:     Names30_2 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  366: 
  367:     Names1_2 = Names10_2 -- OrigNames,
  368:     Names2_2 = Names20_2 -- OrigNames,
  369:     Names3_2 = Names30_2 -- OrigNames,
  370: 
  371:     [p1] = lists:sort(Names1_2),
  372:     [p2] = lists:sort(Names2_2),
  373:     [p1, p2] = lists:sort(Names3_2),
  374: 
  375:     %% Let go of the lock, and expect the lockers to resolve the name
  376:     %% registry.
  377:     Locker ! {ok, self()},
  378: 
  379:     ?UNTIL(begin
  380: 	       Names10_3 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  381: 	       Names20_3 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  382: 	       Names30_3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  383: 
  384: 	       Names1_3 = Names10_3 -- OrigNames,
  385: 	       Names2_3 = Names20_3 -- OrigNames,
  386: 	       Names3_3 = Names30_3 -- OrigNames,
  387: 
  388: 	       N1 = lists:sort(Names1_3),
  389: 	       N2 = lists:sort(Names2_3),
  390: 	       N3 = lists:sort(Names3_3),
  391: 	       (N1 =:= [p1, p2]) and (N2 =:= [p1, p2]) and (N3 =:= [p1, p2])
  392: 	   end),
  393: 
  394:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  395:     stop_node(Cp1),
  396:     stop_node(Cp2),
  397:     stop_node(Cp3),
  398: 
  399:     init_condition(Config),
  400:     ok.
  401: 
  402: %% OTP-6428. An unregistered name reappears.
  403: lost_unregister(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  404:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  405:         true ->
  406:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions enabled"};
  407:         false ->
  408:             lost_unregister_test(Config)
  409:     end.
  410: 
  411: lost_unregister_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  412:     Timeout = 30,
  413:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  414:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  415:     init_condition(Config),
  416: 
  417:     {ok, B} = start_node(b, Config),
  418:     {ok, C} = start_node(c, Config),
  419:     Nodes = [node(), B, C],
  420: 
  421:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  422: 
  423:     %% start a proc and register it
  424:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  425: 
  426:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  427:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  428: 
  429:     rpc_disconnect_node(B, C, Config),
  430:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  431:     _ = rpc:call(B, global, unregister_name, [test]),
  432:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  433:     Pid = rpc:call(C, global, whereis_name, [test]),
  434:     check_everywhere(Nodes--[C], test, Config),
  435:     pong = rpc:call(B, net_adm, ping, [C]),
  436: 
  437:     %% Now the name has reappeared on node B.
  438:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  439:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  440: 
  441:     exit_p(Pid),
  442: 
  443:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  444:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  445: 
  446:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  447:     stop_node(B),
  448:     stop_node(C),
  449:     init_condition(Config),
  450:     ok.
  451: 
  452: lost_connection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  453:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  454:         true ->
  455:             lost_connection_test(Config);
  456:         false ->
  457:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
  458:     end.
  459: 
  460: lost_connection_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  461:     %% OTP-17843: Registered names could become inconsistent due to
  462:     %%            overlapping partitions. This has been solved by
  463:     %%            global actively disconnecting nodes to prevent
  464:     %%            overlapping partitions.
  465:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 15}),
  466: 
  467:     [Cp1, Cp2] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2], peer, Config),
  468: 
  469:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1, Cp2]]),
  470: 
  471:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  472: 
  473:     {Gurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  474: 
  475:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1, Cp2], gurka, Config),
  476: 
  477:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  478: 
  479:     erlang:disconnect_node(Cp2), %% lost connection previously causing issues...
  480: 
  481:     erpc:call(
  482:       PartCtrlr,
  483:       fun () ->
  484:               erpc:call(
  485:                 Cp2,
  486:                 fun () ->
  487:                         {AltGurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  488:                         AltGurka = global:whereis_name(gurka)
  489:                 end),
  490:               timer:sleep(1000),
  491:               erpc:cast(Cp2, erlang, halt, []),
  492:               wait_until(fun () -> not lists:member(Cp2, nodes(hidden)) end)
  493:       end),
  494: 
  495:     Reconnected = case lists:member(Cp1, nodes()) of
  496:                       true ->
  497:                           false;
  498:                       false ->
  499:                           erlang:display("reconnecting Cp1"),
  500:                           pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
  501:                           timer:sleep(500),
  502:                           true
  503:                   end,
  504:     
  505:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1], gurka, Config),
  506: 
  507:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  508: 
  509:     ok = global:unregister_name(gurka),
  510: 
  511:     stop_node(Cp1),
  512:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
  513: 
  514:     {comment, case Reconnected of
  515:                   true -> "Re-connected Cp1";
  516:                   false -> "No re-connection of Cp1 needed"
  517:               end}.
  518: 
  519: lost_connection2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  520:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  521:         true ->
  522:             lost_connection2_test(Config);
  523:         false ->
  524:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
  525:     end.
  526: 
  527: lost_connection2_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     %% OTP-17843: Registered names could become inconsistent due to
  529:     %%            overlapping partitions. This has been solved by
  530:     %%            global actively disconnecting nodes to prevent
  531:     %%            overlapping partitions.
  532:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 15}),
  533: 
  534:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4], peer, Config),
  535: 
  536:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4]]),
  537: 
  538:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  539: 
  540:     {Gurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  541: 
  542:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1, Cp2], gurka, Config),
  543: 
  544:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  545: 
  546:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, Cp3, Cp4),
  547: 
  548:     Nodes = nodes(),
  549:     true = lists:member(Cp1, Nodes),
  550:     true = lists:member(Cp2, Nodes),
  551:     false = lists:member(Cp3, Nodes),
  552:     false = lists:member(Cp4, Nodes),
  553: 
  554:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
  555:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp4),
  556: 
  557:     stop_node(Cp1),
  558:     stop_node(Cp2),
  559:     stop_node(Cp3),
  560:     stop_node(Cp4),
  561:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
  562: 
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: -define(UNTIL_LOOP, 300).
  566: 
  567: -define(end_tag, 'end at').
  568: 
  569: init_high_level_trace(Time) ->
  570:     Mul = try 
  571:               test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()
  572: 	  catch _:_ -> 1
  573:           end,
  574:     put(?end_tag, msec() + Time * Mul * 1000),
  575:     %% Assures that started nodes start the high level trace automatically.
  576:     ok = gen_server:call(global_name_server, high_level_trace_start,infinity),
  577:     os:putenv("GLOBAL_HIGH_LEVEL_TRACE", "TRUE"),
  578:     put(?nodes_tag, []).
  579: 
  580: loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N) ->
  581:     %% ?DBG([{n, N}]),
  582:     put(n, N),
  583:     case Fun() of
  584: 	true ->
  585: 	    true;
  586: 	_ ->
  587:             case get(?end_tag) of
  588:                 undefined ->
  589:                     timer:sleep(?UNTIL_LOOP),
  590:                     loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N+1);
  591:                 EndAt ->
  592:                     Left = EndAt - msec(),
  593:                     case Left < 6000 of
  594:                         true -> 
  595:                             write_high_level_trace(Config),
  596:                             Ref = make_ref(),
  597:                             receive Ref -> ok end;
  598:                         false ->
  599:                             timer:sleep(?UNTIL_LOOP),
  600:                             loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N+1)
  601:                     end
  602:             end
  603:     end.
  604: 
  605: write_high_level_trace(Config) ->
  606:     case erase(?nodes_tag) of
  607:         undefined -> 
  608:             ok;
  609:         Nodes0 -> 
  610:             Nodes = lists:usort([node() | Nodes0]),            
  611:             write_high_level_trace(Nodes, Config)
  612:     end.
  613: 
  614: write_high_level_trace(Nodes, Config) ->
  615:     When = erlang:timestamp(),
  616:     %% 'info' returns more than the trace, which is nice.
  617:     Data = [{Node, {info, rpc:call(Node, global, info, [])}} ||
  618:                Node <- Nodes],
  619:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  620:     DataFile = filename:join([Dir, lists:concat(["global_", ?testcase])]),
  621:     io:format("\n\nAnalyze high level trace like this:\n"),
  622:     io:format("global_trace:dd(~p, [{show_state, 0, 10}]). % 10 seconds\n",
  623:              [DataFile]),
  624:     file:write_file(DataFile, term_to_binary({high_level_trace, When, Data})).
  625: 
  626: lock_global2(Id, Parent) ->
  627:     S = global:set_lock(Id),
  628:     Parent ! {locked, S},
  629:     receive
  630: 	{ok, Parent} ->
  631: 	    ok
  632:     end.
  633: 
  634: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  635: %% Test suite for global names and locks.
  636: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
  637: %% erl -sname XXX -rsh ctrsh where XX not in [cp1, cp2, cp3]
  638: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  639: 
  640: %% cp1 - cp3 are started, and the name 'test' registered for a process on
  641: %% test_server. Then it is checked that the name is registered on all
  642: %% nodes, using whereis_name. Check that the same
  643: %% name can't be registered with another value. Exit the registered
  644: %% process and check that the name disappears. Register a new process
  645: %% (Pid2) under the name 'test'. Let another new process (Pid3)
  646: %% reregister itself under the same name. Test global:send/2. Test
  647: %% unregister. Kill Pid3. Start a process (Pid6) on cp3,
  648: %% register it as 'test', stop cp1 - cp3 and check that 'test' disappeared.
  649: %% Kill Pid2 and check that 'test' isn't registered.
  650: 
  651: names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     ?TC_TRY(names, fun() -> do_names(Config) end).
  653: 
  654: do_names(Config) ->
  655:     ?P("names -> begin when"
  656:        "~n   Nodes: ~p"
  657:        "~n   Names: ~p",
  658:        [nodes(),
  659:         case net_adm:names() of
  660:             {ok, N} ->
  661:                 N;
  662:             _ ->
  663:                 "-"
  664:         end]),
  665:     Timeout = 30,
  666:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  667:     ?P("names -> init high level trace"),
  668:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  669:     ?P("names -> init condition"),
  670:     init_condition(Config),
  671:     ?P("names -> get registered names"),
  672:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  673: 
  674:     ?P("names -> start node cp1"),
  675:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  676:     ?P("names -> start node cp2"),
  677:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  678:     ?P("names -> start node cp3"),
  679:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
  680: 
  681:     ?P("names -> wait for ready net"),
  682:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  683: 
  684:     %% start a proc and register it
  685:     ?P("names -> start and register process 'test'"),
  686:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  687: 
  688:     %% test that it is registered at all nodes
  689:     ?P("names -> verify process has been registered on all nodes"),
  690:         ?UNTIL(begin
  691:             (Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  692:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  693:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  694:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  695:             ([test] =:= global:registered_names() -- OrigNames)
  696:            end),
  697:     
  698:     %% try to register the same name
  699:     ?P("names -> try register (locally) another 'test' (and expect rejection)"),
  700:     no = global:register_name(test, self()),
  701:     ?P("names -> try register (on cp1) another 'test' (and expect rejection)"),
  702:     no = rpc:call(Cp1, global, register_name, [test, self()]),
  703:     
  704:     %% let process exit, check that it is unregistered automatically
  705:     ?P("names -> terminate the 'test' process"),
  706:     exit_p(Pid),
  707: 
  708:     ?P("names -> verify 'test' process has been automatically unregistered"),
  709:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  710:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  711:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  712:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  713:     
  714:     %% test re_register
  715:     ?P("names -> start and register another process 'test'"),
  716:     {Pid2, yes} = start_proc(test),
  717:     ?P("names -> verify process 'test' has been registered"),
  718:     ?UNTIL(Pid2 =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  719:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc2, [test]),
  720:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  721:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test),
  722: 
  723:     %% test sending
  724:     ?P("names -> test sending (from local)"),
  725:     global:send(test, {ping, self()}),
  726:     receive
  727: 	{pong, Cp3} -> ok
  728:     after
  729: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout1)
  730:     end,
  731: 
  732:     ?P("names -> test sending (from cp1)"),
  733:     rpc:call(Cp1, global, send, [test, {ping, self()}]),
  734:     receive
  735: 	{pong, Cp3} -> ok
  736:     after
  737: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout2)
  738:     end,
  739: 
  740:     ?P("names -> unregister 'test' process"),
  741:     _ = global:unregister_name(test),
  742:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  743:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  744:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  745:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  746: 
  747:     ?P("names -> terminate process 'test'"),
  748:     exit_p(Pid3),
  749: 
  750:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  751:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  752: 
  753:     %% register a proc
  754:     ?P("names -> register a process"),
  755:     {_Pid6, yes} = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
  756: 
  757:     ?P("names -> write high level trace"),
  758:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  759: 
  760:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure names are released.
  761:     ?P("names -> stop node cp1"),
  762:     stop_node(Cp1),
  763:     ?P("names -> stop node cp2"),
  764:     stop_node(Cp2),
  765:     ?P("names -> stop node cp3"),
  766:     stop_node(Cp3),
  767: 
  768:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  769:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  770:     exit_p(Pid2),
  771: 
  772:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  773:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  774:     init_condition(Config),
  775: 
  776:     ?P("names -> done"),
  777:     ok.
  778: 
  779: %% Tests that names on a hidden node doesn't interfere with names on
  780: %% visible nodes.
  781: names_hidden(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  782:     Timeout = 30,
  783:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  784:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  785:     init_condition(Config),
  786:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  787:     OrigNodes = nodes(),
  788: 
  789:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  790:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  791:     {ok, Cp3} = start_hidden_node(cp3, Config),
  792:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
  793:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
  794:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
  795: 
  796:     [] = [Cp1, Cp2 | OrigNodes] -- nodes(),
  797: 
  798:     %% start a proc on hidden node and register it
  799:     {HPid, yes} = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
  800:     Cp3 = node(HPid),
  801: 
  802:     %% Check that it didn't get registered on visible nodes
  803:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  804:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  805:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  806: 
  807:     %% start a proc on visible node and register it
  808:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  809:     true = (Pid =/= HPid),
  810: 
  811:     %% test that it is registered at all nodes
  812:         ?UNTIL((Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  813:            (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  814:            (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  815:            (HPid =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  816:            ([test] =:= global:registered_names() -- OrigNames)),
  817:     
  818:     %% try to register the same name
  819:     no = global:register_name(test, self()),
  820:     no = rpc:call(Cp1, global, register_name, [test, self()]),
  821:     
  822:     %% let process exit, check that it is unregistered automatically
  823:     exit_p(Pid),
  824: 
  825:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  826:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  827:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  828:            (HPid      =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  829:     
  830:     %% test re_register
  831:     {Pid2, yes} = start_proc(test),
  832:     ?UNTIL(Pid2 =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  833:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc2, [test]),
  834:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  835:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test),
  836: 
  837:     %% test sending
  838:     Pid3 = global:send(test, {ping, self()}),
  839:     receive
  840: 	{pong, Cp2} -> ok
  841:     after
  842: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout1)
  843:     end,
  844: 
  845:     rpc:call(Cp1, global, send, [test, {ping, self()}]),
  846:     receive
  847: 	{pong, Cp2} -> ok
  848:     after
  849: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout2)
  850:     end,
  851: 
  852:     _ = rpc:call(Cp3, global, unregister_name, [test]),
  853:         ?UNTIL((Pid3      =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  854:            (Pid3      =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  855:            (Pid3      =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  856:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  857: 
  858:     _ = global:unregister_name(test),
  859:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  860:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  861:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  862:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  863: 
  864:     exit_p(Pid3),
  865:     exit_p(HPid),
  866: 
  867:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  868: 
  869:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  870: 
  871:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure names are released.
  872:     stop_node(Cp1),
  873:     stop_node(Cp2),
  874:     stop_node(Cp3),
  875: 
  876:     init_condition(Config),
  877:     ok.
  878: 
  879: locks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  880:     Timeout = 30,
  881:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  882:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  883:     init_condition(Config),
  884:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  885:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  886:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
  887: 
  888:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  889: 
  890:     %% start two procs
  891:     Pid = start_proc(),
  892:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  893: 
  894:     %% set a lock, and make sure no one else can set the same lock
  895:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  896:     false = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  897:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  898: 
  899:     %% delete, and let another proc set the lock
  900:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  901:     true = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  902:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  903:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1),
  904: 
  905:     %% kill lock-holding proc, make sure the lock is released
  906:     exit_p(Pid),
  907:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1)),
  908:     Pid2 ! {set_lock_loop, test_lock, self()},
  909: 
  910:     %% make sure we don't have the msg
  911:     receive
  912: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ct:fail(got_lock)
  913:     after
  914: 	1000 -> ok
  915:     end,
  916:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  917: 
  918:     %% make sure pid2 got the lock
  919:     receive
  920: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ok
  921:     after
  922: 	%% 12000 >> 5000, which is the max time before a new retry for
  923:         %% set_lock
  924: 	12000 -> ct:fail(got_lock2)
  925:     end,
  926: 
  927:     %% let proc set the same lock
  928:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  929: 
  930:     %% let proc set new lock
  931:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
  932:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()},?NODES,1),
  933:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES,1),
  934:     exit_p(Pid2),
  935:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  936:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  937:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  938:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  939: 
  940:     %% let proc set two locks
  941:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  942:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  943:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
  944: 
  945:     %% del one lock
  946:     Pid3 ! {del_lock, test_lock2},
  947:     ct:sleep(100),
  948: 
  949:     %% check that one lock is still set, but not the other
  950:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  951:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  952:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  953: 
  954:     %% kill lock-holder
  955:     exit_p(Pid3),
  956: 
  957:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  958:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  959:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  960:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  961: 
  962:     %% start one proc on each node
  963:     Pid4 = start_proc(),
  964:     Pid5 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  965:     Pid6 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  966:     Pid7 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  967: 
  968:     %% set lock on two nodes
  969:     true = req(Pid4, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
  970:     false = req(Pid5, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
  971: 
  972:     %% set same lock on other two nodes
  973:     true = req(Pid6, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
  974:     false = req(Pid7, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
  975: 
  976:     %% release lock
  977:     Pid6 ! {del_lock, test_lock, [Cp2, Cp3]},
  978: 
  979:     %% try to set lock on a node that already has the lock
  980:     false = req(Pid6, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]}),
  981: 
  982:     %% set lock on a node
  983:     exit_p(Pid4),
  984:     ?UNTIL(true =:= req(Pid5, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]})),
  985:     Pid8 = start_proc(),
  986:     false = req(Pid8, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  987:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  988: 
  989:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure locks are released.
  990:     stop_node(Cp1),
  991:     stop_node(Cp2),
  992:     stop_node(Cp3),
  993:     ct:sleep(100),
  994:     true = req(Pid8, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  995:     exit_p(Pid8),
  996:     ct:sleep(10),
  997: 
  998:     init_condition(Config),
  999:     ok.
 1000: 
 1001: 
 1002: %% Tests that locks on a hidden node doesn't interere with locks on
 1003: %% visible nodes.
 1004: locks_hidden(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1005:     Timeout = 30,
 1006:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1007:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1008:     init_condition(Config),
 1009:     OrigNodes = nodes(),
 1010:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1011:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1012:     {ok, Cp3} = start_hidden_node(cp3, Config),
 1013:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 1014:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
 1015:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
 1016: 
 1017:     [] = [Cp1, Cp2 | OrigNodes] -- nodes(),
 1018: 
 1019:     %% start two procs
 1020:     Pid = start_proc(),
 1021:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1022:     HPid = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1023: 
 1024:     %% Make sure hidden node doesn't interfere with visible nodes lock
 1025:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1026:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
 1027:     false = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1028:     true = req(HPid, {del_lock_sync, test_lock, self()}),
 1029:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1030: 
 1031:     %% delete, and let another proc set the lock
 1032:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1033:     true = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1034:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1035:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1),
 1036: 
 1037:     %% kill lock-holding proc, make sure the lock is released
 1038:     exit_p(Pid),
 1039:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1040:     ?UNTIL(true =:= req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()})),
 1041:     Pid2 ! {set_lock_loop, test_lock, self()},
 1042: 
 1043:     %% make sure we don't have the msg
 1044:     receive
 1045: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ct:fail(got_lock)
 1046:     after
 1047: 	1000 -> ok
 1048:     end,
 1049:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1050: 
 1051:     %% make sure pid2 got the lock
 1052:     receive
 1053: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ok
 1054:     after
 1055: 	%% 12000 >> 5000, which is the max time before a new retry for
 1056:         %% set_lock
 1057: 	12000 -> ct:fail(got_lock2)
 1058:     end,
 1059:     true = req(HPid, {del_lock_sync, test_lock, self()}),
 1060: 
 1061:     %% let proc set the same lock
 1062:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1063: 
 1064:     %% let proc set new lock
 1065:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
 1066:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1067:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
 1068:     exit_p(HPid),
 1069:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()},?NODES,1),
 1070:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES,1),
 1071: 
 1072:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1073:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1074:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1075:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1076:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
 1077: 
 1078:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1079: 
 1080:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure locks are released.
 1081:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1082:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1083:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1084: 
 1085:     init_condition(Config),
 1086:     ok.
 1087: 
 1088: 
 1089: bad_input(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1090:     Timeout = 15,
 1091:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1092:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1093:     init_condition(Config),
 1094:     Pid = whereis(global_name_server),
 1095:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(bad_id)),
 1096:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock({id, self()}, bad_nodes)),
 1097:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:del_lock(bad_id)),
 1098:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:del_lock({id, self()}, bad_nodes)),
 1099:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:register_name(name, bad_pid)),
 1100:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:reregister_name(name, bad_pid)),
 1101:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(bad_id, {m,f})),
 1102:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans({id, self()}, {m,f}, [node()], -1)),
 1103:     Pid = whereis(global_name_server),
 1104:     init_condition(Config),
 1105:     ok.
 1106: 
 1107: names_and_locks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1108:     Timeout = 30,
 1109:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1110:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1111:     init_condition(Config),
 1112:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1113: 
 1114:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1115:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1116:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
 1117: 
 1118:     %% start one proc on each node
 1119:     PidTS = start_proc(),
 1120:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1121:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1122:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1123: 
 1124:     %% register some of them
 1125:     yes = global:register_name(test1, Pid1),
 1126:     yes = global:register_name(test2, Pid2),
 1127:     yes = global:register_name(test3, Pid3),
 1128:     no = global:register_name(test3, PidTS),
 1129:     yes = global:register_name(test4, PidTS),
 1130: 
 1131:     %% set lock on two nodes
 1132:     true = req(PidTS, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
 1133:     false = req(Pid1, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
 1134: 
 1135:     %% set same lock on other two nodes
 1136:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1137:     false = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1138: 
 1139:     %% release lock
 1140:     Pid2 ! {del_lock, test_lock, [Cp2, Cp3]},
 1141:     ct:sleep(100),
 1142: 
 1143:     %% try to set lock on a node that already has the lock
 1144:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1145: 
 1146:     %% set two locks
 1147:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1148:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1149: 
 1150:     %% kill some processes, make sure all locks/names are released
 1151:     exit_p(PidTS),
 1152:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1153:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, [node(), Cp1], 1),
 1154:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}, [node(), Cp1]),
 1155:     
 1156:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1157:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test2)) and
 1158:            (true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3], 1)) and
 1159:            (true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3], 1))),
 1160: 
 1161:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3]),
 1162:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3]),
 1163: 
 1164:     exit_p(Pid1),
 1165:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1166: 
 1167:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1168: 
 1169:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1170:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1171:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1172:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1173: 
 1174:     init_condition(Config),
 1175:     ok.
 1176: 
 1177: %% OTP-6341. Remove locks using monitors.
 1178: lock_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1179:     Timeout = 30,
 1180:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1181:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1182:     init_condition(Config),
 1183:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1184: 
 1185:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1186:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1187: 
 1188:     %% First test.
 1189:     LockId = {id, self()},
 1190:     Pid2 = start_proc(),
 1191:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, LockId, self()}),
 1192: 
 1193:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, [Cp1]),
 1194:     %% Id is locked on Cp1 and Cp2 (by Pid2) but not by self(): 
 1195:     %% (there is no mon. ref)
 1196:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1, Cp2]),
 1197: 
 1198:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1199: 
 1200:     %% Second test.
 1201:     Pid3 = start_proc(),
 1202:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, id, self(), [Cp1]}),
 1203:     %% The lock is removed from Cp1 thanks to monitors.
 1204:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1205: 
 1206:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1]),
 1207:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1]),
 1208: 
 1209:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1210:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1211:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1212:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1213:     init_condition(Config),
 1214:     ok.
 1215: 
 1216: %% OTP-6341. Remove names using monitors.
 1217: name_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1218:     Timeout = 30,
 1219:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1220:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1221:     init_condition(Config),
 1222:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1223:     [Cp1] = Cps = start_nodes([z], peer,  Config), % z > test_server
 1224:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 1225:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1226: 
 1227:     Name = name_die,
 1228:     Pid = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1229: 
 1230:     %% Test 1. No resolver is called if the same pid is registered on
 1231:     %% both partitions.
 1232:     T1 = node(),
 1233:     Part1 = [T1],
 1234:     Part2 = [Cp1],
 1235: 
 1236:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [Part1, Part2]),
 1237: 
 1238:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1239:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid),
 1240: 
 1241:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
 1242:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1243:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1244:     exit_p(Pid),
 1245:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1246: 
 1247:     %% Test 2. Register a name running outside the current partition.
 1248:     %% Killing the pid will not remove the name from the current
 1249:     %% partition, unless monitors are used.
 1250:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1251:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1252:     KillFile = filename:join([Dir, "kill.txt"]),
 1253:     file:delete(KillFile),
 1254:     erlang:spawn(Cp1, fun() -> kill_pid(Pid2, KillFile, Config) end),
 1255: 
 1256:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, [Part1, Part2]),
 1257: 
 1258:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1259:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid2),
 1260:     touch(KillFile, "kill"),
 1261:     file_contents(KillFile, "done", Config),
 1262:     file:delete(KillFile),
 1263: 
 1264:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1265:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1266:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 1267:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1268:     init_condition(Config),
 1269:     ok.
 1270: 
 1271: kill_pid(Pid, File, Config) ->
 1272:     file_contents(File, "kill", Config),
 1273:     exit_p(Pid),
 1274:     touch(File, "done").
 1275: 
 1276: %% Tests that two partitioned networks exchange correct info.
 1277: basic_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1278:     Timeout = 30,
 1279:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1280:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1281:     init_condition(Config),
 1282:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1283: 
 1284:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], peer, Config),
 1285:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = lists:sort(nodes()),
 1286: 
 1287:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1288: 
 1289:     %% make cp2 and cp3 connected, partitioned from us and cp1
 1290:     PCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1], [Cp2, Cp3]]),
 1291: 
 1292:     %% start different processes in both partitions
 1293:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
 1294: 
 1295:     %% Reach into the other partition via PCtrlr...
 1296:     ok = erpc:call(
 1297:            PCtrlr,
 1298:            fun () ->
 1299:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE,
 1300:                                         start_proc, [test2]),
 1301:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE,
 1302:                                         start_proc, [test4]),
 1303:                    ok
 1304:            end),
 1305: 
 1306:     %% connect to other partition
 1307:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp2),
 1308:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1309:     wait_until(fun () -> [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] == lists:sort(nodes()) end),
 1310: 
 1311:     %% check names
 1312:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
 1313:     ?UNTIL(undefined =/= global:whereis_name(test2)),
 1314:     Pid2 = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1315:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test2]),
 1316:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 1317:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test4),
 1318:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test4])),
 1319:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1320: 
 1321:     %% kill all procs
 1322:     Pid3 = global:send(test4, die),
 1323:     %% sleep to let the proc die
 1324:     wait_for_exit(Pid3),
 1325:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1326: 
 1327:     exit_p(Pid),
 1328:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1329: 
 1330:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1331: 
 1332:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1333:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1334:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1335:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1336:     stop_node(PCtrlr),
 1337:     init_condition(Config),
 1338:     ok.
 1339: 
 1340: %% Creates two partitions with two nodes in each partition.
 1341: %% Tests that names are exchanged correctly, and that EXITs
 1342: %% during connect phase are handled correctly.
 1343: basic_name_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1344:     Timeout = 60,
 1345:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1346:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1347:     init_condition(Config),
 1348:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1349: 
 1350:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], peer, Config),
 1351:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = lists:sort(nodes()),
 1352:     Nodes = ?NODES,
 1353: 
 1354:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1355: 
 1356:     %% There used to be more than one name registered for some
 1357:     %% processes. That was a mistake; there is no support for more than
 1358:     %% one name per process, and the manual is quite clear about that
 1359:     %% ("equivalent to the register/2 and whereis/1 BIFs"). The
 1360:     %% resolver procedure did not take care of such "duplicated" names,
 1361:     %% which caused this testcase to fail every now and then.
 1362: 
 1363:     %% make cp2 and cp3 connected, partitioned from us and cp1
 1364:     %% us:  register name03
 1365:     %% cp1: register name12
 1366:     %% cp2: register name12
 1367:     %% cp3: register name03
 1368: 
 1369:     PCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1], [Cp2, Cp3]]),
 1370: 
 1371:     %% start different processes in both partitions
 1372:     {_, yes} = start_proc_basic(name03),
 1373:     {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc_basic, [name12]),
 1374: 
 1375:     %% Reach into the other partition via PCtrlr...
 1376:     ok = erpc:call(
 1377:            PCtrlr,
 1378:            fun () ->
 1379:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE,
 1380:                                         start_proc_basic, [name12]),
 1381:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE,
 1382:                                         start_proc_basic, [name03]),
 1383:                    ok
 1384:            end),
 1385: 
 1386:     ct:sleep(1000),
 1387: 
 1388:     %% connect to other partition
 1389:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1390: 
 1391:     ?UNTIL([Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 1392:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1393: 
 1394:     %% check names
 1395:     Pid03 = global:whereis_name(name03),
 1396:     assert_pid(Pid03),
 1397:     true = lists:member(node(Pid03), [node(), Cp3]),
 1398:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name03, Config),
 1399: 
 1400:     Pid12 = global:whereis_name(name12),
 1401:     assert_pid(Pid12),
 1402:     true = lists:member(node(Pid12), [Cp1, Cp2]),
 1403:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name12, Config),
 1404: 
 1405:     %% kill all procs
 1406:     Pid12 = global:send(name12, die),
 1407:     Pid03 = global:send(name03, die),
 1408: 
 1409:     %% sleep to let the procs die
 1410:     wait_for_exit(Pid12),
 1411:     wait_for_exit(Pid03),
 1412:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1413: 	       Names = [name03, name12],
 1414: 	       lists:duplicate(length(Names), undefined)
 1415: 		   =:= [global:whereis_name(Name) || Name <- Names]
 1416: 	   end),
 1417: 
 1418:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1419: 
 1420:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1421:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1422:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1423:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1424:     stop_node(PCtrlr),
 1425:     init_condition(Config),
 1426:     ok.
 1427: 
 1428: %% Peer nodes cp0 - cp6 are started. Break apart the connections from
 1429: %% cp3-cp6 to cp0-cp2 and test_server so we get two partitions.
 1430: %% In the cp3-cp6 partition, start one process on each node and register
 1431: %% using both erlang:register, and global:register (test1 on cp3, test2 on
 1432: %% cp4, test3 on cp5, test4 on cp6), using different resolution functions:
 1433: %% default for test1, notify_all_name for test2, random_notify_name for test3
 1434: %% and one for test4 that sends a message to test_server and keeps the
 1435: %% process which is greater in the standard ordering. In the other partition,
 1436: %% do the same (test1 on test_server, test2 on cp0, test3 on cp1, test4 on cp2).
 1437: %% Sleep a little, then from test_server, connect to cp3-cp6 in order.
 1438: %% Check that the values for the registered names are the expected ones, and
 1439: %% that the messages from test4 arrive.
 1440: 
 1441: %% Test that names are resolved correctly when two
 1442: %% partitioned networks connect.
 1443: advanced_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1444:     Timeout = 60,
 1445:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1446:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1447:     init_condition(Config),
 1448:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1449: 
 1450:     Parent = self(),
 1451: 
 1452:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]
 1453: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6], peer, Config),
 1454:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]),
 1455:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1456: 
 1457:     %% make cp3-cp6 connected, partitioned from us and cp0-cp2
 1458:     PCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2], [Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]]),
 1459: 
 1460:     %% start processes in other partition (via partition controller)...
 1461:     _ = erpc:call(PCntrlr,
 1462:                   fun () ->
 1463:                           erpc:call(Cp3,
 1464:                                     fun () ->
 1465:                                             start_procs(Parent, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Config)
 1466:                                     end)
 1467:                   end),
 1468: 
 1469:     %% start different processes in this partition
 1470:     start_procs(self(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Config),
 1471: 
 1472:     %% connect to other partition
 1473:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1474: 
 1475:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1476:                        CurrNodes = lists:sort(?NODES),
 1477:                        io:format("CurrNodes: ~p~n", [CurrNodes]),
 1478:                        Nodes == CurrNodes end),
 1479: 
 1480:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1481: 
 1482:     ?UNTIL(lists:member(undefined,
 1483: 			[rpc:call(Cp3, erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1484: 			 rpc:call(node(), erlang, whereis, [test1])])),
 1485: 
 1486:     Nt1 = rpc:call(Cp3, erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1487:     Nt2 = rpc:call(Cp4, erlang, whereis, [test2]),
 1488:     Nt3 = rpc:call(Cp5, erlang, whereis, [test3]),
 1489:     Nt4 = rpc:call(Cp6, erlang, whereis, [test4]),
 1490: 
 1491:     Mt1 = rpc:call(node(), erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1492:     Mt2 = rpc:call(Cp0, erlang, whereis, [test2]),
 1493:     Mt3 = rpc:call(Cp1, erlang, whereis, [test3]),
 1494:     _Mt4 = rpc:call(Cp2, erlang, whereis, [test4]),
 1495: 
 1496:     %% check names
 1497:     Pid1 = global:whereis_name(test1),
 1498:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test1]),
 1499:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 1500:     true = lists:member(Pid1, [Nt1, Mt1]),
 1501:     true = lists:member(undefined, [Nt1, Mt1]),
 1502:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test1, Config),
 1503: 
 1504:     undefined = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1505:     undefined = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test2]),
 1506:     yes = sreq(Nt2, {got_notify, self()}),
 1507:     yes = sreq(Mt2, {got_notify, self()}),
 1508:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test2, Config),
 1509: 
 1510:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test3),
 1511:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test3]),
 1512:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1513:     true = lists:member(Pid3, [Nt3, Mt3]),
 1514:     no = sreq(Pid3, {got_notify, self()}),
 1515:     yes = sreq(other(Pid3, [Nt2, Nt3]), {got_notify, self()}),
 1516:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test3, Config),
 1517: 
 1518:     Pid4 = global:whereis_name(test4),
 1519:     Pid4 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test4]),
 1520:     assert_pid(Pid4),
 1521:     Pid4 = Nt4,
 1522:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test4, Config),
 1523: 
 1524:     1 = collect_resolves(),
 1525: 
 1526:     Pid1 = global:send(test1, die),
 1527:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1528:     exit_p(Pid4),
 1529:     wait_for_exit(Pid1),
 1530:     wait_for_exit(Pid3),
 1531:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1532: 
 1533:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1534:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1535:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1536:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1537:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1538:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1539:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1540:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1541:     stop_node(PCntrlr),
 1542:     init_condition(Config),
 1543:     ok.
 1544: 
 1545: %% Peer nodes cp0 - cp6 are started, and partitioned just like in
 1546: %% advanced_partition. Start cp8, only connected to test_server. Let cp6
 1547: %% break apart from the rest, and 12 s later, ping cp0 and cp3, and
 1548: %% register the name test5. After the same 12 s, let cp5 halt.
 1549: %% Wait for the death of cp5. Ping cp3 (at the same time as cp6 does).
 1550: %% Take down cp2. Start cp7, restart cp2. Ping cp4, cp6 and cp8.
 1551: %% Now, expect all nodes to be connected and have the same picture of all
 1552: %% registered names.
 1553: 
 1554: %% Stress global, make a partitioned net, make some nodes
 1555: %% go up/down a bit.
 1556: stress_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1557:     Timeout = 90,
 1558:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1559:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1560:     init_condition(Config),
 1561:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1562: 
 1563:     Parent = self(),
 1564: 
 1565:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a, Cp6b]
 1566: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6a, cp6b], peer, Config),
 1567: 
 1568:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1569: 
 1570:     %% make cp3-cp5 connected, partitioned from us and cp0-cp2
 1571:     %% cp6 is alone (single node).  cp6 pings cp0 and cp3 in 12 secs...
 1572:     PCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2], [Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a], [Cp6b]]),
 1573: 
 1574:     %% start processes in other partition (via partition controller)...
 1575:     _ = erpc:call(PCntrlr,
 1576:                   fun () ->
 1577:                           erpc:call(Cp3,
 1578:                                     fun () ->
 1579:                                             start_procs(Parent, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a, Config)
 1580:                                     end),
 1581:                           erpc:call(Cp6b,
 1582:                                     fun () ->
 1583:                                             Pid1 = start_proc3(test1),
 1584:                                             assert_pid(Pid1),
 1585:                                             Pid2 = start_proc3(test3),
 1586:                                             assert_pid(Pid2),
 1587:                                             yes = global:register_name(
 1588:                                                     test1, Pid1),
 1589:                                             yes = global:register_name(
 1590:                                                     test3, Pid2,
 1591:                                                     fun global:random_notify_name/3)
 1592:                                     end),
 1593:                           %% Make Cp5 crash
 1594:                           erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, crash, [12000]),
 1595:                           %% Make Cp6b alone
 1596:                           erpc:cast(Cp6b, ?MODULE, alone, [Cp0, Cp3])
 1597:                   end),
 1598: 
 1599:     erlang:display(starting_test),
 1600:     %% start different processes in this partition
 1601:     start_procs(self(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Config),
 1602: 
 1603:     {ok, Cp8} = start_peer_node(cp8, Config),
 1604: 
 1605:     monitor_node(Cp5, true),
 1606:     receive
 1607: 	{nodedown, Cp5} -> ok
 1608:     after
 1609: 	20000 -> ct:fail({no_nodedown, Cp5})
 1610:     end,
 1611:     monitor_node(Cp5, false),    
 1612: 
 1613:     %% Ok, now cp6 pings us, and cp5 will go down.
 1614: 
 1615:     %% connect to other partition
 1616:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1617:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp4),
 1618:     rpc_cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, crash, [0]),
 1619: 
 1620:     %% Start new nodes
 1621:     {ok, Cp7} = start_peer_node(cp7, Config),
 1622:     {ok, Cp2_2} = start_peer_node(cp2, Config),
 1623:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2_2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp6a, Cp6b, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1624:     put(?nodes_tag, Nodes),
 1625: 
 1626:     %% We don't know how the crashes partitions the net, so
 1627:     %% we cast trough all nodes so we get them all connected
 1628:     %% again...
 1629:     cast_line(Nodes),
 1630: 
 1631:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1632: 
 1633:     %% Make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1634:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test1, Config),
 1635:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test1)),
 1636: 
 1637:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test2, Config),
 1638:     undefined = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1639: 
 1640:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test3, Config),
 1641:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test3)),
 1642: 
 1643:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test4, Config),
 1644:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1645: 
 1646:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test5, Config),
 1647:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test5)),
 1648: 
 1649:     assert_pid(global:send(test1, die)),
 1650:     assert_pid(global:send(test3, die)),
 1651:     assert_pid(global:send(test4, die)),
 1652: 
 1653:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1654: 
 1655:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1656:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1657:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1658:     stop_node(Cp2_2),
 1659:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1660:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1661:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1662:     stop_node(Cp6a),
 1663:     stop_node(Cp6b),
 1664:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1665:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1666:     stop_node(PCntrlr),
 1667:     init_condition(Config),
 1668:     ok.
 1669: 
 1670: 
 1671: %% Use this one to test a lot of connection tests
 1672: %%  erl -sname ts -ring_line 10000 -s test_server run_test global_SUITE
 1673: 
 1674: ring_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1675:     {ok, [[N]]} = init:get_argument(ring_line),
 1676:     loop_it(list_to_integer(N), Config).
 1677: 
 1678: loop_it(N, Config) -> loop_it(N,N, Config).
 1679: 
 1680: loop_it(0,_, _Config) -> ok;
 1681: loop_it(N,M, Config) ->
 1682:     ct:pal(?HI_VERBOSITY, "Round: ~w", [M-N]),
 1683:     ring(Config),
 1684:     line(Config),
 1685:     loop_it(N-1,M, Config).
 1686: 
 1687: 
 1688: %% Make 10 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1689: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a ring.
 1690: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1691: ring(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1692:     Timeout = 60,
 1693:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1694:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1695:     init_condition(Config),
 1696:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1697: 
 1698:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]
 1699: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6, cp7, cp8], 
 1700:                       peer, Config),
 1701:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1702: 
 1703:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1704: 
 1705:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1706:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1707:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5], [Cp6], [Cp7], [Cp8]]),
 1708: 
 1709:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1710: 
 1711:     ok = erpc:call(
 1712:            PartCtrlr,
 1713:            fun () ->
 1714:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp8]), % ping ourself!
 1715:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1716:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1717:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1718:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1719:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1720:                    erpc:cast(Cp6, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1721:                    erpc:cast(Cp7, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp6]),
 1722:                    erpc:cast(Cp8, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp7]),
 1723:                    ok
 1724:            end),
 1725: 
 1726:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp0),
 1727: 
 1728:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1729: 
 1730:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1731:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1732:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1733: 
 1734:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1735:                {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis, 
 1736:                                          [single_name]),
 1737:                9 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1738:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1739:                                  end,
 1740:                                  0, Ns2)
 1741:            end),
 1742: 
 1743:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1744: 
 1745:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1746: 
 1747:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1748:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1749:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1750:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1751:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1752:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1753:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1754:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1755:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1756:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1757:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1758:     init_condition(Config),
 1759:     ok.
 1760: 
 1761: %% Simpler version of the ring case.  Used because there are some
 1762: %% distribution problems with many nodes.
 1763: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1764: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a ring.
 1765: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1766: simple_ring(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1767:     Timeout = 60,
 1768:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1769:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1770:     init_condition(Config),
 1771:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1772: 
 1773:     Names = [cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5],
 1774:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]
 1775: 	= start_nodes(Names, peer, Config),
 1776:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]),
 1777: 
 1778:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1779: 
 1780:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1781:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1782:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5]]),
 1783:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1784: 
 1785:     ok = erpc:call(
 1786:            PartCtrlr,
 1787:            fun () ->
 1788:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]), % ping ourself!
 1789:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1790:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1791:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1792:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1793:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1794:                    ok
 1795:            end),
 1796: 
 1797:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp0),
 1798: 
 1799:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1800: 
 1801:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1802:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1803:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1804: 
 1805:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1806:                {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis, 
 1807:                                          [single_name]),
 1808:                6 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1809:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1810:                                  end,
 1811:                                  0, Ns2)
 1812:            end),
 1813: 
 1814:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1815: 
 1816:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1817: 
 1818:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1819:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1820:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1821:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1822:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1823:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1824:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1825:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1826:     init_condition(Config),
 1827:     ok.
 1828: 
 1829: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1830: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a line.
 1831: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1832: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1833:     Timeout = 60,
 1834:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1835:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1836:     init_condition(Config),
 1837:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1838: 
 1839:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]
 1840: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6, cp7, cp8], 
 1841:                       peer, Config),
 1842:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1843: 
 1844:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1845: 
 1846:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1847:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1848:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5], [Cp6], [Cp7], [Cp8]]),
 1849:     ThisNode = node(),
 1850: 
 1851:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1852:     ok = erpc:call(
 1853:            PartCtrlr,
 1854:            fun () ->
 1855:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]), % ping ourself!
 1856:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1857:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1858:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1859:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1860:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1861:                    erpc:cast(Cp6, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1862:                    erpc:cast(Cp7, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp6]),
 1863:                    erpc:cast(Cp8, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp7]),
 1864:                    erpc:cast(ThisNode, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp8]),
 1865:                    ok
 1866:            end),
 1867: 
 1868:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1869: 
 1870:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1871:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1872:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1873: 
 1874:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1875: 	       {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis,
 1876: 					 [single_name]),
 1877:  	       9 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1878:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1879:                                  end,
 1880:                                  0, Ns2)
 1881: 	   end),
 1882: 
 1883:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1884: 
 1885:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1886: 
 1887:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1888:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1889:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1890:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1891:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1892:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1893:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1894:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1895:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1896:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1897:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1898:     init_condition(Config),
 1899:     ok.
 1900: 
 1901: 
 1902: %% Simpler version of the line case.  Used because there are some
 1903: %% distribution problems with many nodes.
 1904: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1905: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a line.
 1906: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1907: simple_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1908:     Timeout = 60,
 1909:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1910:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1911:     init_condition(Config),
 1912:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1913: 
 1914:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]
 1915: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5], peer, Config),
 1916:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]),
 1917: 
 1918:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1919: 
 1920:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1921:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1922:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5]]),
 1923:     ThisNode = node(),
 1924: 
 1925:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1926:     ok = erpc:call(
 1927:            PartCtrlr,
 1928:            fun () ->
 1929:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]), % ping ourself!
 1930:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1931:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1932:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1933:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1934:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1935:                    erpc:cast(ThisNode, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1936:                    ok
 1937:            end),
 1938: 
 1939:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1940: 
 1941:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1942:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1943:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1944: 
 1945:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1946: 	       {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis,
 1947: 					 [single_name]),
 1948:  	       6 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1949:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1950:                                  end,
 1951:                                  0, Ns2)
 1952: 	   end),
 1953: 
 1954:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1955: 
 1956:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1957: 
 1958:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1959:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1960:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1961:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1962:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1963:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1964:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1965:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1966:     init_condition(Config),
 1967:     ok.
 1968: 
 1969: %% Test ticket: Global should keep track of all pids that set the same lock.
 1970: otp_1849(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1971:     Timeout = 30,
 1972:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1973:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1974:     init_condition(Config),
 1975:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1976:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1977:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
 1978: 
 1979:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1980: 
 1981:     %% start procs on each node
 1982:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1983:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 1984:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1985:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 1986:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1987:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1988: 
 1989:     %% set a lock on every node
 1990:     true = req(Pid1, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1991:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1992:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1993: 
 1994:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1995:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock1}] = 
 1996:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 1997:                3 =:= length(Lock1)
 1998:            end),
 1999: 
 2000:     true = req(Pid3, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2001:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2002:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock2}] = 
 2003:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2004:                2 =:= length(Lock2)
 2005:            end),
 2006: 
 2007:     true = req(Pid2, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2008:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2009:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock3}] = 
 2010:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2011:                1 =:= length(Lock3)
 2012:            end),
 2013: 
 2014:     true = req(Pid1, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
