 2015:     ?UNTIL([] =:= rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks])),
 2016: 
 2017: 
 2018:     true = req(Pid1, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2019:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2020:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2021:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, not_valid}, self()}),
 2022: 
 2023:     exit_p(Pid1),
 2024:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2025:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock10}] = 
 2026:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2027:                2 =:= length(Lock10)
 2028:            end),
 2029:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2030:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock11}] = 
 2031:                    rpc:call(Cp2, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2032:                2 =:= length(Lock11)
 2033:            end),
 2034:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2035:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock12}] = 
 2036:                    rpc:call(Cp3, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2037:                2 =:= length(Lock12)
 2038:            end),
 2039: 
 2040:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2041:     stop_node(Cp1),
 2042:     stop_node(Cp2),
 2043:     stop_node(Cp3),
 2044:     init_condition(Config),
 2045:     ok.
 2046: 
 2047: 
 2048: %% Test ticket: Deadlock in global.
 2049: otp_3162(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2050:     StartFun = fun() ->
 2051:                        {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, peer, Config),
 2052:                        {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, peer, Config),
 2053:                        {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, peer, Config),
 2054:                        [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]
 2055:                end,
 2056:     do_otp_3162(StartFun, Config).
 2057: 
 2058: do_otp_3162(StartFun, Config) ->
 2059:     Timeout = 30,
 2060:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2061:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2062:     init_condition(Config),
 2063:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = StartFun(),
 2064: 
 2065:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2066: 
 2067:     ThisNode = node(),
 2068: 
 2069:     PartCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[ThisNode, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]]),
 2070: 
 2071:     %% start procs on each node
 2072:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [kalle]),
 2073:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 2074:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [stina]),
 2075:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 2076:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [vera]),
 2077:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 2078: 
 2079:     disconnect_nodes(PartCntrlr, Cp1, Cp2),
 2080:     %% Nowadays we do not know how the net have been partitioned after the
 2081:     %% disconnect, so we cannot perform all the tests this testcase originally
 2082:     %% did. We instead only test the end result is ok after we have reconnected
 2083:     %% all nodes.
 2084: 
 2085:     erpc:call(PartCntrlr,
 2086:               fun () ->
 2087:                       erpc:cast(Cp1, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3]),
 2088:                       erpc:cast(Cp2, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3]),
 2089:                       erpc:cast(ThisNode, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3])
 2090:               end),
 2091: 
 2092:     ?UNTIL(lists:sort([ThisNode, Cp1, Cp2]) =:=
 2093:                lists:sort(erpc:call(Cp3, erlang, nodes, []))),
 2094:     ?UNTIL([kalle, stina, vera] =:=
 2095: 	       lists:sort(erpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []))),
 2096: 
 2097:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2098:     stop_node(Cp1),
 2099:     stop_node(Cp2),
 2100:     stop_node(Cp3),
 2101:     stop_partition_controller(PartCntrlr),
 2102:     init_condition(Config),
 2103:     ok.
 2104: 
 2105: 
 2106: %% OTP-5640. 'allow' multiple names for registered processes.
 2107: otp_5640(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2108:     Timeout = 25,
 2109:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2110:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2111:     init_condition(Config),
 2112:     {ok, B} = start_node(b, Config),
 2113: 
 2114:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), B]),
 2115:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 2116: 
 2117:     Server = whereis(global_name_server),
 2118:     ServerB = rpc:call(B, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]),
 2119: 
 2120:     Me = self(),
 2121:     Proc = spawn(fun() -> otp_5640_proc(Me) end),
 2122: 
 2123:     yes = global:register_name(name1, Proc),
 2124:     no = global:register_name(name2, Proc),
 2125: 
 2126:     ok = application:set_env(kernel, global_multi_name_action, allow),
 2127:     yes = global:register_name(name2, Proc),
 2128: 
 2129:     ct:sleep(100),
 2130:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2131:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2132:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2133:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2134: 
 2135:     {monitors_2levels, MonBy1} = mon_by_servers(Proc),
 2136:     [] = ([Server,Server,ServerB,ServerB] -- MonBy1),
 2137:     {links,[]} = process_info(Proc, links),
 2138:     _ = global:unregister_name(name1),
 2139: 
 2140:     ct:sleep(100),
 2141:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2142:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2143:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2144:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2145: 
 2146:     {monitors_2levels, MonBy2} = mon_by_servers(Proc),
 2147:     [] = ([Server,ServerB] -- MonBy2),
 2148:     TmpMonBy2 = MonBy2 -- [Server,ServerB],
 2149:     TmpMonBy2 = TmpMonBy2 -- [Server,ServerB],
 2150:     {links,[]} = process_info(Proc, links),
 2151: 
 2152:     yes = global:register_name(name1, Proc),
 2153: 
 2154:     Proc ! die,
 2155: 
 2156:     ct:sleep(100),
 2157:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2158:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2159:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2160:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2161:     {monitors, GMonitors} = process_info(Server, monitors),
 2162:     false = lists:member({process, Proc}, GMonitors),
 2163: 
 2164:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2165:     stop_node(B),
 2166:     init_condition(Config),
 2167:     ok.
 2168: 
 2169: otp_5640_proc(_Parent) ->
 2170:     receive 
 2171:         die ->
 2172:             exit(normal)
 2173:     end.
 2174: 
 2175: %% OTP-5737. set_lock/3 and trans/4 accept Retries = 0.
 2176: otp_5737(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2177:     Timeout = 25,
 2178:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2179:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2180:     init_condition(Config),
 2181: 
 2182:     LockId = {?MODULE,self()},
 2183:     Nodes = [node()],
 2184:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, -1)),
 2185:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, a)),
 2186:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, 0),
 2187:     Time1 = erlang:timestamp(),
 2188:     false = global:set_lock({?MODULE,not_me}, Nodes, 0),
 2189:     true = timer:now_diff(erlang:timestamp(), Time1) < 5000,
 2190:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, Nodes),
 2191: 
 2192:     Fun = fun() -> ok end,
 2193:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, -1)),
 2194:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, a)),
 2195:     ok = global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, 0),
 2196: 
 2197:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2198:     init_condition(Config),
 2199:     ok.
 2200: 
 2201: connect_all_false(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2202:     %% OTP-6931. Ignore nodeup when connect_all=false.
 2203:     connect_all_false_test("-connect_all false", Config),
 2204:     %% OTP-17934: multipl -connect_all false and kernel parameter connect_all
 2205:     connect_all_false_test("-connect_all false -connect_all false", Config),
 2206:     connect_all_false_test("-kernel connect_all false", Config),
 2207:     ok.
 2208: 
 2209: connect_all_false_test(CAArg, Config) ->
 2210:     Me = self(),
 2211:     {ok, CAf} = start_non_connecting_node(ca_false, Config),
 2212:     {ok, false} = rpc:call(CAf, application, get_env, [kernel, connect_all]),
 2213:     ok = rpc:call(CAf, error_logger, add_report_handler, [?MODULE, Me]),
 2214:     info = rpc:call(CAf, error_logger, warning_map, []),
 2215:     {global_name_server,CAf} ! {nodeup, fake_node, #{connection_id => 4711}},
 2216:     timer:sleep(100),
 2217:     stop_node(CAf),
 2218:     receive {nodeup,fake_node, _} ->
 2219:             ct:fail({info_report, was, sent})
 2220:     after 1000 -> ok
 2221:     end,
 2222:     ok.
 2223: 
 2224: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2225: %%% Testing a disconnected node. Not two partitions.
 2226: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2227: %% OTP-5563. Disconnected nodes (not partitions).
 2228: simple_disconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2229:     Timeout = 30,
 2230:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2231:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2232:     init_condition(Config),
 2233:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2234: 
 2235:     %% Three nodes (test_server, n_1, n_2). 
 2236:     [Cp1, Cp2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, n_2], peer, Config),
 2237:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2238: 
 2239:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2240: 
 2241:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2242: 
 2243:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,Nodes),
 2244: 
 2245:     Name = name,
 2246:     Resolver = {no_module, resolve_none}, % will never be called
 2247:     PingNode = Cp2,
 2248: 
 2249:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2250:         rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, [Name, Resolver]),
 2251:     ct:sleep(100),
 2252: 
 2253:     %% Disconnect test_server and Cp2. 
 2254:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, node(), Cp2),
 2255:     %% We might have been disconnected from Cp1 as well. Ensure connected
 2256:     %% to Cp1...
 2257:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
 2258: 
 2259:     %% _Pid is registered on Cp1. The exchange of names between Cp2 and
 2260:     %% test_server sees two identical pids.
 2261:     pong = net_adm:ping(PingNode),
 2262: 
 2263:     ?UNTIL(Cps =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 2264: 
 2265:     {_, Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2266:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2267:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2268:     true = undefined /= global:whereis_name(Name),
 2269:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2270:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2271:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2272:     undefined = global:whereis_name(Name),
 2273: 
 2274:     {_, Trace1} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2275:     Trace = Trace0 ++ Trace1, 
 2276:     [] = [foo || {_, resolve_none, _, _} <- Trace],
 2277: 
 2278:     Gs = name_servers(Nodes),
 2279:     [_, _, _] = monitored_by_node(Trace, Gs),
 2280: 
 2281:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, []) end, Nodes),
 2282: 
 2283:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2284:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2285:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2286:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2287:     init_condition(Config),
 2288:     ok.
 2289: 
 2290: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2291: %%% Testing resolve of name. Many combinations with four nodes.
 2292: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2293: -record(cf, {
 2294:           link,  % node expected to have registered process running
 2295:           ping,  % node in partition 2 to be pinged
 2296:           n1,    % node starting registered process in partition 1
 2297:           n2,    % node starting registered process in partition 2
 2298:           nodes, % nodes expected to exist after ping
 2299:           n_res, % expected number of resolvers after ping
 2300:           config,
 2301:           ctrlr
 2302:          }).
 2303: 
 2304: -define(RES(F), {F, fun ?MODULE:F/3}).
 2305: 
 2306: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2307: simple_resolve(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2308:     Timeout = 360,
 2309:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2310:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2311:     init_condition(Config),
 2312:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2313: 
 2314:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2315:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2316:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2317: 
 2318:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2319: 
 2320:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2321:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2322:                   end, Nodes),
 2323: 
 2324:     %% There used to be a link between global_name_server and the
 2325:     %% registered name. Now there are only monitors, but the field
 2326:     %% name 'link' remains...
 2327: 
 2328:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2329:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2330:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2331: 
 2332:     %% There is no test with a resolver that deletes a pid (like
 2333:     %% global_exit_name does). The resulting DOWN signal just clears
 2334:     %% out the pid from the tables, which should be harmless. So all
 2335:     %% tests are done with resolvers that keep both processes. This
 2336:     %% should catch all cases which used to result in bogus process
 2337:     %% links (now: only monitors are used).
 2338: 
 2339:     %% Two partitions are created in each case below: [node(), n_1]
 2340:     %% and [a_2, z_2]. A name ('name') is registered in both
 2341:     %% partitions whereafter node() or n_1 pings a_2 or z_2. Note that
 2342:     %% node() = test_server, which means that node() < z_2 and node()
 2343:     %% > a_2. The lesser node calls the resolver.
 2344: 
 2345:     %% [The following comment does not apply now that monitors are used.]
 2346:     %% The resolver is run on a_2 with the process on node()
 2347:     %% as first argument. The process registered as 'name' on a_2 is
 2348:     %% removed from the tables. It is unlinked from a_2, and the new
 2349:     %% process (on node()) is inserted without trying to link to it
 2350:     %% (it it known to run on some other node, in the other
 2351:     %% partition). The new process is not sent to the other partition
 2352:     %% for update since it already exists there.
 2353:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2354:     %% The same, but the z_2 takes the place of a_2.
 2355:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2}),
 2356:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2357:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2358:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2359:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2360:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2361:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2362:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2363:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2364: 
 2365:     %% [Maybe this set of tests is the same as (ismorphic to?) the last one.]
 2366:     %% The resolver is run on a_2 with the process on node()
 2367:     %% as first argument. The process registered as 'name' on a_2 is
 2368:     %% the one kept. The old process is unlinked on node(), and the
 2369:     %% new process (on a_2) is inserted without trying to link to it
 2370:     %% (it it known to run on some other node).
 2371:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2}),
 2372:     %% The same, but the z_2 takes the place of a_2.
 2373:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2}),
 2374:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2375:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2376:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2377:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2378:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2379:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2380:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2381:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2382: 
 2383:     %% A resolver that does not return one of the pids.
 2384:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2}),
 2385:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2}),
 2386:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2387:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2388:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2389:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2390:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2391:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2392:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2393:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2394: 
 2395:     %% Both processes are unlinked (demonitored).
 2396:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2}),
 2397:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2}),
 2398:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2399:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2400:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2401:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2402:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2403:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2404: 
 2405:     %% A resolver faking badrpc. The resolver is run on a_2, and the
 2406:     %% process on node() is kept.
 2407:     res(?RES(badrpc_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2408: 
 2409:     %% An exiting resolver. A kind of badrpc.
 2410:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2411:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2}),
 2412:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2413:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2414:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2415:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2416:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2417:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2418: 
 2419:     %% A locker that takes a lock. It used to be that the
 2420:     %% global_name_server was busy exchanging names, which caused a
 2421:     %% deadlock.
 2422:     res(?RES(lock_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node()}),
 2423: 
 2424:     %% A resolver that disconnects from the node of the first pid
 2425:     %% once. The nodedown message is processed (the resolver killed),
 2426:     %% then a new attempt (nodeup etc.) is made. This time the
 2427:     %% resolver does not disconnect any node.
 2428:     res(?RES(disconnect_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2,
 2429: 					   nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2]}),
 2430: 
 2431:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2432: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2433: 		  end, Nodes),
 2434: 
 2435:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2436:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2437:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2438:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2439:     init_condition(Config),
 2440:     ok.
 2441: 
 2442: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2443: simple_resolve2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2444:     %% Continuation of simple_resolve. Of some reason it did not
 2445:     %% always work to re-start z_2. "Cannot be a global bug."
 2446: 
 2447:     Timeout = 30,
 2448:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2449:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2450:     init_condition(Config),
 2451:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2452: 
 2453:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2454:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2455:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2456: 
 2457:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2458: 
 2459:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2460:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2461:                   end, Nodes),
 2462: 
 2463:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2464:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2465:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2466: 
 2467:     %% Halt z_2. 
 2468:     res(?RES(halt_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping  = A2,
 2469: 				      nodes = [node(), N1, A2], n_res = 1}),
 2470: 
 2471:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2472: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2473: 		  end, Nodes),
 2474: 
 2475:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2476:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2477:     stop_nodes(Cps), % Not all nodes may be present, but it works anyway.
 2478:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2479:     init_condition(Config),
 2480:     ok.
 2481: 
 2482: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2483: simple_resolve3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2484:     %% Continuation of simple_resolve.
 2485: 
 2486:     Timeout = 30,
 2487:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2488:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2489:     init_condition(Config),
 2490:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2491: 
 2492:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2493:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2494:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2495: 
 2496:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2497: 
 2498:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2499:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2500:                   end, Nodes),
 2501: 
 2502:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2503:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2504:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2505: 
 2506:     %% Halt a_2. 
 2507:     res(?RES(halt_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2, 
 2508:                                       nodes = [node(), N1], n_res = 1}),
 2509: 
 2510:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2511: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2512: 		  end, Nodes),
 2513: 
 2514:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2515:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2516:     stop_nodes(Cps), % Not all nodes may be present, but it works anyway.
 2517:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2518:     init_condition(Config),
 2519:     ok.
 2520: 
 2521: res({Res,Resolver}, [N1, A2, Z2], Cf) ->
 2522:     %% Note: there are no links anymore, but monitors.
 2523:     #cf{link = LinkedNode, ping = PingNode, n1 = Res1, n2 = OtherNode,
 2524:         nodes = Nodes0, n_res = NRes, config = Config, ctrlr = PartCtrlr} = Cf,
 2525:     io:format("~n~nResolver: ~p", [Res]),
 2526:     io:format(" Registered on partition 1:  ~p", [Res1]),
 2527:     io:format(" Registered on partition 2:  ~p", [OtherNode]),
 2528:     io:format(" Pinged node:                ~p", [PingNode]),
 2529:     io:format(" Linked node:                ~p", [LinkedNode]),
 2530:     io:format(" Expected # resolvers:       ~p", [NRes]),
 2531:     Nodes = lists:sort(Nodes0),
 2532:     T1 = node(),
 2533:     Part1 = [T1, N1],
 2534:     Part2 = [A2, Z2],
 2535:     Name = name,
 2536: 
 2537:     %% A registered name is resolved in different scenarios with just
 2538:     %% four nodes. In each scenario it is checked that exactly the
 2539:     %% expected monitors remain between registered processes and the
 2540:     %% global_name_server.
 2541: 
 2542:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, [Part1, Part2]),
 2543: 
 2544:     erpc:call(PartCtrlr,
 2545:               fun () ->
 2546:                       erpc:call(OtherNode,
 2547:                                 fun () ->
 2548:                                         {Pid2, yes} = start_resolver(Name,
 2549:                                                                      Resolver),
 2550:                                         trace_message({node(), part_2_2,
 2551:                                                        nodes(), {pid2,Pid2}})
 2552:                                 end)
 2553:               end),
 2554: 
 2555:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2556:         rpc:call(Res1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, [Name, Resolver]),
 2557: 
 2558:     pong = net_adm:ping(PingNode),
 2559:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 2560: 
 2561:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2562:     case global:whereis_name(Name) of
 2563: 	undefined when LinkedNode =:= none -> ok;
 2564: 	Pid -> assert_pid(Pid)
 2565:     end,
 2566: 
 2567:     {_, Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2568:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2569: 
 2570:     NRes = length(Resolvers),
 2571: 
 2572:     %% Wait for extra monitor processes to be created.
 2573:     %% This applies as long as global:do_monitor/1 spawns processes.
 2574:     %% (Some day monitor() will be truly synchronous.)
 2575:     ct:sleep(100),
 2576: 
 2577:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2578:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2579: 
 2580:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2581:     undefined = global:whereis_name(Name),
 2582: 
 2583:     %% Wait for monitors to remove names.
 2584:     ct:sleep(100),
 2585: 
 2586:     {_, Trace1} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2587:     Trace = Trace0 ++ Trace1, 
 2588: 
 2589:     Gs = name_servers([T1, N1, A2, Z2]),
 2590:     MonitoredByNode = monitored_by_node(Trace, Gs),
 2591:     MonitoredBy = [M || {_N,M} <- MonitoredByNode],
 2592: 
 2593:     X = MonitoredBy -- Gs,
 2594:     LengthGs = length(Gs),
 2595:     case MonitoredBy of
 2596: 	[] when LinkedNode =:= none -> ok;
 2597: 	Gs -> ok;
 2598: 	_ when LengthGs < 4, X =:= [] -> ok;
 2599: 	_ -> io:format("ERROR:~nMonitoredBy ~p~n"
 2600: 		       "global_name_servers ~p~n",
 2601: 		       [MonitoredByNode, Gs]),
 2602: 	     ct:fail(monitor_mismatch)
 2603:     end,
 2604:     ok.
 2605: 
 2606: name_servers(Nodes) ->
 2607:     lists:sort([rpc:call(N, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]) || 
 2608:                    N <- Nodes,
 2609:                    pong =:= net_adm:ping(N)]).
 2610: 
 2611: monitored_by_node(Trace, Servers) ->
 2612:     lists:sort([{node(M),M} || 
 2613:                    {_Node,_P,died,{monitors_2levels,ML}} <- Trace, 
 2614:                    M <- ML,
 2615:                    lists:member(M, Servers)]).
 2616: 
 2617: resolve_first(name, Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2618:     Pid1.
 2619: 
 2620: resolve_second(name, _Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2621:     Pid2.
 2622: 
 2623: resolve_none(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2624:     none.
 2625: 
 2626: bad_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2627:     bad_answer.
 2628: 
 2629: badrpc_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2630:     {badrpc, badrpc}.
 2631: 
 2632: exit_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2633:     erlang:error(bad_resolver).
 2634: 
 2635: lock_resolver(name, Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2636:     Id = {?MODULE, self()},
 2637:     Nodes = [node()],
 2638:     true = global:set_lock(Id, Nodes),
 2639:     _ = global:del_lock(Id, Nodes),
 2640:     Pid1.
 2641: 
 2642: disconnect_first(name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2643:     Name = disconnect_first_name,
 2644:     case whereis(Name) of
 2645:         undefined -> 
 2646:             spawn(fun() -> disconnect_first_name(Name) end),
 2647:             true = erlang:disconnect_node(node(Pid1));
 2648:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 2649:             Pid ! die
 2650:     end,
 2651:     Pid2.
 2652: 
 2653: disconnect_first_name(Name) ->
 2654:     register(Name, self()),
 2655:     receive die -> ok end.
 2656: 
 2657: halt_second(name, _Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2658:     rpc:call(node(Pid2), erlang, halt, []),
 2659:     Pid2.
 2660: 
 2661: start_resolver(Name, Resolver) ->
 2662:     Self = self(), 
 2663:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> init_resolver(Self, Name, Resolver) end),
 2664:     trace_message({node(), new_resolver, {pid, Pid}}),
 2665:     receive
 2666: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 2667:     end.
 2668: 
 2669: init_resolver(Parent, Name, Resolver) ->
 2670:     X = global:register_name(Name, self(), Resolver),
 2671:     Parent ! {self(), X},
 2672:     loop_resolver().
 2673: 
 2674: loop_resolver() ->
 2675:     receive
 2676:         die ->
 2677:             trace_message({node(), self(), died, mon_by_servers(self())}),
 2678:             exit(normal)
 2679:     end.
 2680: 
 2681: %% The server sometimes uses an extra process for monitoring. 
 2682: %% The server monitors that extra process.
 2683: mon_by_servers(Proc) ->
 2684:     {monitored_by, ML} = process_info(Proc, monitored_by),
 2685:     {monitors_2levels, 
 2686:      lists:append([ML | 
 2687:                    [begin
 2688:                         {monitored_by, MML} = rpc:call(node(M), 
 2689:                                                        erlang, 
 2690:                                                        process_info, 
 2691:                                                        [M, monitored_by]),
 2692:                         MML
 2693:                     end || M <- ML]])}.
 2694: 
 2695: -define(REGNAME, contact_a_2).
 2696: 
 2697: %% OTP-5563. Bug: nodedown while syncing.
 2698: leftover_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2699:     Timeout = 30,
 2700:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2701:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2702:     init_condition(Config),
 2703:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2704:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer,  Config),
 2705:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2706:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2707: 
 2708:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2709:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2710:                   end, Nodes),
 2711: 
 2712:     Name = name, % registered on a_2
 2713:     ResName = resolved_name, % registered on n_1 and a_2
 2714:     %% 
 2715:     _Pid = ping_a_2_fun(?REGNAME, N1, A2),
 2716: 
 2717:     T1 = node(),
 2718:     Part1 = [T1, N1],
 2719:     Part2 = [A2, Z2],
 2720:     NoResolver = {no_module, resolve_none},
 2721:     Resolver = fun contact_a_2/3,
 2722: 
 2723:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [Part1, Part2]),
 2724: 
 2725:     erpc:call(
 2726:       PartCtrlr,
 2727:       fun () ->
 2728:               erpc:call(
 2729:                 A2,
 2730:                 fun () ->
 2731:                         lists:foreach(
 2732:                           fun({TheName, TheResolver}) ->
 2733:                                   {Pid2, yes} = start_resolver(TheName, TheResolver),
 2734:                                   trace_message({node(), part_2_2, nodes(), {pid2,Pid2}})
 2735:                           end, [{Name, NoResolver}, {ResName, Resolver}])
 2736:                 end)
 2737:       end),
 2738: 
 2739:     %% resolved_name is resolved to run on a_2, an insert operation is
 2740:     %% sent to n_1. The resolver function halts a_2, but the nodedown
 2741:     %% message is handled by n_1 _before_ the insert operation is run
 2742:     %% (at least every now and then; sometimes it seems to be
 2743:     %% delayed). Unless "artificial" nodedown messages are sent the
 2744:     %% name would linger on indefinitely. [There is no test case for
 2745:     %% the situation that no nodedown message at all is sent.]
 2746:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2747:         rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, 
 2748:                  [ResName, fun contact_a_2/3]),
 2749:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2750: 
 2751:     trace_message({node(), pinging, z_2}),
 2752:     pong = net_adm:ping(Z2),
 2753:     ?UNTIL((Nodes -- [A2]) =:= lists:sort(?NODES)),
 2754:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2755: 
 2756:     {_,Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2757: 
 2758:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2759:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2760:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2761: 
 2762:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2763: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2764: 		  end, Nodes),
 2765: 
 2766:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2767:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2768:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2769:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2770:     init_condition(Config),
 2771:     ok.
 2772: 
 2773: %% Runs on n_1
 2774: contact_a_2(resolved_name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2775:     trace_message({node(), ?REGNAME, {pid1,Pid1}, {pid2,Pid2}, 
 2776: 		   {node1,node(Pid1)}, {node2,node(Pid2)}}),
 2777:     ?REGNAME ! doit,
 2778:     Pid2.
 2779: 
 2780: ping_a_2_fun(RegName, N1, A2) ->
 2781:     spawn(N1, fun() -> ping_a_2(RegName, N1, A2) end).
 2782: 
 2783: ping_a_2(RegName, N1, A2) ->
 2784:     register(RegName, self()),
 2785:     receive doit -> 
 2786:             trace_message({node(), ping_a_2, {a2, A2}}),
 2787:             monitor_node(A2, true),
 2788:             %% Establish contact with a_2, then take it down.
 2789:             rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, halt_node, [A2]),
 2790:             receive
 2791:                 {nodedown, A2} -> ok
 2792:             end
 2793:     end.
 2794: 
 2795: halt_node(Node) ->
 2796:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, []).
 2797: 
 2798: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2799: %%% Testing re-registration of a name.
 2800: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2801: %% OTP-5563. Name is re-registered.
 2802: re_register_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2803:     %% When re-registering a name the link to the old pid used to
 2804:     %% linger on. Don't think is was a serious bug though--some memory
 2805:     %% occupied by links, that's all.
 2806:     %% Later: now monitors are checked.
 2807:     Timeout = 15,
 2808:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2809:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2810:     init_condition(Config),
 2811:     Me = self(),
 2812:     Pid1 = spawn(fun() -> proc(Me) end),
 2813:     yes = global:register_name(name, Pid1),
 2814:     wait_for_monitor(Pid1),
 2815:     Pid2 = spawn(fun() -> proc(Me) end),
 2816:     _ = global:re_register_name(name, Pid2),
 2817:     wait_for_monitor(Pid2),
 2818:     Pid2 ! die,
 2819:     Pid1 ! die,
 2820:     receive {Pid1, MonitoredBy1} -> [] = MonitoredBy1 end,
 2821:     receive {Pid2, MonitoredBy2} -> [_] = MonitoredBy2 end,
 2822:     _ = global:unregister_name(name),
 2823:     init_condition(Config),
 2824:     ok.
 2825: 
 2826: wait_for_monitor(Pid) ->
 2827:     case process_info(Pid, monitored_by) of
 2828:         {monitored_by, []} ->
 2829:             timer:sleep(1),
 2830:             wait_for_monitor(Pid);
 2831:         {monitored_by, [_]} ->
 2832:             ok
 2833:     end.
 2834: 
 2835: proc(Parent) ->
 2836:     receive die -> ok end,
 2837:     {monitored_by, MonitoredBy} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 2838:     Parent ! {self(), MonitoredBy}.
 2839: 
 2840: 
 2841: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2842: %%% 
 2843: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2844: %% OTP-5563. Registered process dies.
 2845: name_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2846:     StartFun = fun() ->
 2847:                        {ok, N1} = start_node_rel(n_1, this, Config),
 2848:                        {ok, N2} = start_node_rel(n_2, this, Config),
 2849:                        [N1, N2]
 2850:                end,
 2851:     io:format("Test of current release~n"),
 2852:     do_name_exit(StartFun, current, Config).
 2853: 
 2854: do_name_exit(StartFun, Version, Config) ->
 2855:     %% When a registered process dies, the node where it is registered
 2856:     %% removes the name from the table immediately, and then removes
 2857:     %% it from other nodes using a lock.
 2858:     %% This is perhaps not how it should work, but it is not easy to
 2859:     %% change.
 2860:     %% See also OTP-3737.
 2861:     %%
 2862:     %% The current release uses monitors so this test is not so relevant.
 2863: 
 2864:     Timeout = 60,
 2865:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2866:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2867:     init_condition(Config),
 2868:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2869: 
 2870:     %% Three nodes (test_server, n_1, n_2). 
 2871:     Cps = StartFun(),
 2872:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2873:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2874:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,Nodes),
 2875: 
 2876:     Name = name,
 2877:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(Name),
 2878: 
 2879:     Me = self(),
 2880:     LL = spawn(fun() -> long_lock(Me) end),
 2881:     receive 
 2882:         long_lock_taken -> ok
 2883:     end,
 2884: 
 2885:     Pid ! die,                    
 2886:     wait_for_exit_fast(Pid),
 2887: 
 2888:     ct:sleep(100),
 2889:     %% Name has been removed from node()'s table, but nowhere else
 2890:     %% since there is a lock on 'global'.
 2891:     {R1,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, global, whereis_name, [Name]),
 2892:     case Version of
 2893: 	old -> [_,_] = lists:usort(R1);
 2894: 	current -> [undefined, undefined, undefined] = R1
 2895:     end,
 2896:     ct:sleep(3000),
 2897:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2898: 
 2899:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, []) end, Nodes),
 2900:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2901:     exit(LL, kill),
 2902:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2903:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2904:     init_condition(Config),
 2905:     ok.
 2906: 
 2907: long_lock(Parent) ->
 2908:     global:trans({?GLOBAL_LOCK,self()}, 
 2909:                  fun() -> 
 2910:                          Parent ! long_lock_taken,
 2911:                          timer:sleep(3000) 
 2912:                  end).
 2913: 
 2914: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2915: %%% Testing the support for external nodes (cnodes)
 2916: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2917: %% OTP-5563. External nodes (cnodes).
 2918: external_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2919:     Timeout = 30,
 2920:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2921:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2922:     init_condition(Config),
 2923:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2924: 
 2925:     [NodeB, NodeC] = start_nodes([b, c], peer, Config),
 2926:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2927: 
 2928:     %% Nodes = ?NODES,
 2929:     %% lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,
 2930:     %%               Nodes),
 2931:     Name = name,
 2932: 
 2933:     %% Two partitions: [test_server] and [b, c].
 2934:     %% c registers an external name on b
 2935: 
 2936:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node()], [NodeB, NodeC]]),
 2937: 
 2938:     erpc:call(
 2939:       PartCtrlr,
 2940:       fun () ->
 2941:               erpc:call(
 2942:                 NodeB,
 2943:                 fun () ->
 2944:                         Pid = spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(NodeB) end),
 2945:                         Pid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2946:                         receive {Pid, Reply} -> yes = Reply end,
 2947:                         erpc:call(NodeC, erlang, register, [Name, Pid])
 2948:                 end)
 2949:       end),
 2950: 
 2951:     pong = net_adm:ping(NodeB),
 2952:     ?UNTIL([NodeB, NodeC] =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 2953:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2954: 
 2955:     Cpid = rpc:call(NodeC, erlang, whereis, [Name]),
 2956:     ExternalName = [{name,Cpid,NodeB}],
 2957:     ExternalName = get_ext_names(),
 2958:     ExternalName = rpc:call(NodeB, gen_server, call,
 2959: 			    [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2960:     ExternalName = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2961: 			    [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2962: 
 2963:     [_] = cnode_links(Cpid),
 2964:     [_,_,_] = cnode_monitored_by(Cpid),
 2965:     no = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 2966:     yes = global:re_register_name(Name, self()),
 2967:     ?UNTIL([] =:= cnode_monitored_by(Cpid)),
 2968:     ?UNTIL([] =:= cnode_links(Cpid)),
 2969:     [] = gen_server:call(global_name_server, get_names_ext, infinity),
 2970: 
 2971:     Cpid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2972:     receive {Cpid, Reply1} -> no = Reply1 end,
 2973:     _ = global:unregister_name(Name),
 2974:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2975:     Cpid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2976:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 1),
 2977:     receive {Cpid, Reply2} -> yes = Reply2 end,
 2978: 
 2979:     Cpid ! {unregister, self(), Name},
 2980:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 0),
 2981:     receive {Cpid, Reply3} -> ok = Reply3 end,
 2982: 
 2983:     Cpid ! die,
 2984:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2985:     [] = get_ext_names(),
 2986:     [] = rpc:call(NodeB, gen_server, call,
 2987: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2988:     [] = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2989: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2990: 
 2991:     Cpid2 = erlang:spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(NodeB) end),
 2992:     Cpid2 ! {register, self(), Name},
 2993:     receive {Cpid2, Reply4} -> yes = Reply4 end,
 2994: 
 2995:     %% It could be a bug that Cpid2 is linked to 'global_name_server'
 2996:     %% at node 'b'. The effect: Cpid2 dies when node 'b' crashes.
 2997:     stop_node(NodeB),
 2998:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2999:     [] = get_ext_names(),
 3000:     [] = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 3001: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 3002: 
 3003:     %% {_, Trace} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 3004:     %% lists:foreach(fun(M) -> erlang:display(M) end, Trace),
 3005: 
 3006:     ThisNode = node(),
 3007:     Cpid3 = erlang:spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(ThisNode) end),
 3008:     Cpid3 ! {register, self(), Name},
 3009:     receive {Cpid3, Reply5} -> yes = Reply5 end,
 3010: 
 3011:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 1),
 3012:     stop_node(NodeC),
 3013:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 3014:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 0),
 3015: 
 3016:     init_condition(Config),
 3017:     ok.
 3018: 
 3019: get_ext_names() ->
 3020:     gen_server:call(global_name_server, get_names_ext, infinity).
 3021: 
 3022: cnode_links(Pid) ->
 3023:     Pid ! {links, self()},
 3024:     receive 
 3025:         {links, Links} ->
 3026:             Links
 3027:     end.
 3028: 
 3029: cnode_monitored_by(Pid) ->
 3030:     Pid ! {monitored_by, self()},
 3031:     receive 
 3032:         {monitored_by, MonitoredBy} ->
 3033:             MonitoredBy
 3034:     end.
 3035: 
 3036: cnode_proc(E) ->
 3037:     receive
 3038:         {register, From, Name} ->
 3039:             Rep = rpc:call(E, global, register_name_external, [Name, self()]),
 3040:             From ! {self(), Rep};
 3041:         {unregister, From, Name} ->
 3042:             _ = rpc:call(E, global, unregister_name_external, [Name]),
 3043:             From ! {self(), ok};
 3044:         {links, From} ->
 3045:             From ! process_info(self(), links);
 3046:         {monitored_by, From} ->
 3047:             From ! process_info(self(), monitored_by);
 3048:         die ->
 3049:             exit(normal)
 3050:     end,
 3051:     cnode_proc(E).
 3052: 
 3053: 
 3054: %% OTP-5770. Start many nodes. Make them connect at the same time.
 3055: many_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3056:     Timeout = 240,
 3057:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3058:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3059:     init_condition(Config),
 3060:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 3061: 
 3062:     {Rels, N_cps} = 
 3063:         case os:type() of
 3064:             {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux; 
 3065:                                 Osname =:= openbsd; 
 3066:                                 Osname =:= darwin ->
 3067:                 N_nodes = quite_a_few_nodes(32),
 3068:                 {node_rel(1, N_nodes), N_nodes};
 3069:             {unix, _} ->
 3070:                 {node_rel(1, 32), 32};
 3071:             _ -> 
 3072:                 {node_rel(1, 32), 32}
 3073:         end,
 3074:     Cps = [begin {ok, Cp} = start_node_rel(Name, Rel, Config), Cp end ||
 3075: 	      {Name,Rel} <- Rels],
 3076:     Nodes = lists:sort(?NODES),
 3077:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 3078: 
 3079:     %% All nodes isolated not connected to any other (visible) nodes...
 3080:     Partitions = [[node()] | lists:map(fun (Node) -> [Node] end, Cps)],
 3081: 
 3082:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, Partitions),
 3083: 
 3084:     Time = msec(),
 3085: 
 3086:     erpc:call(
 3087:       PartCtrlr,
 3088:       fun () ->
 3089:               OkRes = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, Cps),
 3090:               OkRes = erpc:multicall(
 3091:                         Cps,
 3092:                         fun () ->
 3093:                                 lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 3094:                                                       _ = net_adm:ping(N)
 3095:                                               end, shuffle(Cps)),
 3096:                                 ?UNTIL((Cps -- get_known(node())) =:= []),
 3097:                                 ok
 3098:                         end),
 3099:               ok
 3100:       end),
 3101: 
 3102:     Time2 = msec(),
 3103: 
 3104:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> pong = net_adm:ping(N) end, Cps),
 3105: 
 3106:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 3107: 
 3108:     write_high_level_trace(Config), % The test succeeded, but was it slow?
 3109: 
 3110:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 3111:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 3112:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 3113:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 3114:     init_condition(Config),
 3115:     Diff = Time2 - Time,
 3116:     Return = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w nodes took ~w ms", 
 3117:                                          [N_cps, Diff])),
 3118:     erlang:display({{nodes,N_cps},{time,Diff}}),
 3119:     io:format("~s~n", [Return]),
 3120:     {comment, Return}.
 3121: 
 3122: node_rel(From, To) ->
 3123:     NodeNumbers = lists:seq(From, To),
 3124:     Release = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
 3125:     LastRelease = integer_to_list(list_to_integer(Release) - 1) ++ "_latest",
 3126:     Last = case test_server:is_release_available(LastRelease) of
 3127:                true -> list_to_atom(LastRelease);
 3128:                false -> this
 3129:            end,
 3130:     [{lists:concat([cp, N]),
 3131:       case N rem 2 of
 3132:           0 -> this;
 3133:           1 -> Last
 3134:       end} || N <- NodeNumbers].
 3135: 
 3136: touch(File, List) ->
 3137:     ok = file:write_file(File, list_to_binary(List)).
 3138: 
 3139: append_to_file(File, Term) ->
 3140:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [raw,binary,append]),
 3141:     ok = file:write(Fd, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [Term])),
 3142:     ok = file:close(Fd).
 3143: 
 3144: file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config) ->
 3145:     file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config, no_log_file).
 3146: 
 3147: file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config, LogFile) ->
 3148:     Contents = list_to_binary(ContentsList),    
 3149:     Sz = size(Contents),
 3150:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3151:                case file:read_file(File) of
 3152:                    {ok, FileContents}=Reply -> 
 3153:                        case catch split_binary(FileContents, Sz) of
 3154:                            {Contents,_} ->
 3155:                                true;
 3156:                            _ ->
 3157:                                catch append_to_file(LogFile,
 3158:                                                     {File,Contents,Reply}),
 3159:                                false
 3160:                        end;
 3161:                    Reply ->
 3162:                        catch append_to_file(LogFile, {File, Contents, Reply}),
 3163:                        false
 3164:                end
 3165:            end).
 3166: 
 3167: shuffle(L) ->
 3168:     [E || {_, E} <- lists:keysort(1, [{rand:uniform(), E} || E <- L])].
 3169: 
 3170: %% OTP-5770. sync/0.
 3171: sync_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3172:     Timeout = 180,
 3173:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3174:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3175:     init_condition(Config),
 3176: 
 3177:     N_cps = 
 3178:         case os:type() of
 3179:             {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux; 
 3180:                                 Osname =:= openbsd; 
 3181:                                 Osname =:= darwin ->
 3182:                 quite_a_few_nodes(30);
 3183:             {unix, sunos} ->
 3184:                 30;
 3185:             {unix, _} ->
 3186:                 16;
 3187:             _ -> 
 3188:                 30
 3189:         end,
 3190: 
 3191:     Names = [lists:concat([cp,N]) || N <- lists:seq(1, N_cps)],
 3192:     Cps = start_and_sync(Names),
 3193:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 3194:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 3195:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 3196: 
 3197:     init_condition(Config),
 3198:     ok.
 3199: 
 3200: start_and_sync([]) ->
 3201:     [];
 3202: start_and_sync([Name | Names]) ->
 3203:     {ok, N} = start_node(Name, slave, []),
 3204:     {Time, _Void} = rpc:call(N, timer, tc, [global, sync, []]),
 3205:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [Name, Time]),
 3206:     [N | start_and_sync(Names)].
 3207: 
 3208: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3209: %%% Testing of change of global_groups parameter.
 3210: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3211: %% Test change of global_groups parameter.
 3212: global_groups_change(Config) ->
 3213:     Timeout = 90,
 3214:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3215:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3216:     init_condition(Config),
 3217:     M = from($@, atom_to_list(node())),
 3218: 
 3219:     %% Create the .app files and the boot script
 3220:     {KernelVer, StdlibVer} = create_script_dc("dc"),
 3221:     case is_real_system(KernelVer, StdlibVer) of
 3222: 	true ->
 3223: 	    Options = [];
 3224: 	false  ->
 3225: 	    Options = [local]
 3226:     end,
 3227: 
 3228:     ok = systools:make_script("dc", Options),
 3229: 
 3230:     [Ncp1,Ncp2,Ncp3,Ncp4,Ncp5,NcpA,NcpB,NcpC,NcpD,NcpE] = 
 3231:         node_names([cp1,cp2,cp3,cp4,cp5,cpA,cpB,cpC,cpD,cpE], Config),
 3232: 
 3233:     %% Write config files
 3234:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 3235:     {ok, Fd_dc} = file:open(filename:join(Dir, "sys.config"), [write]),
 3236:     config_dc1(Fd_dc, Ncp1, Ncp2, Ncp3, NcpA, NcpB, NcpC, NcpD, NcpE),
 3237:     file:close(Fd_dc),
 3238:     Config1 = filename:join(Dir, "sys"),
 3239: 
 3240:     %% Test [cp1, cp2, cp3]
 3241:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node_boot(Ncp1, Config1, dc),
 3242:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node_boot(Ncp2, Config1, dc),
 3243:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node_boot(Ncp3, Config1, dc),
 3244:     {ok, CpA} = start_node_boot(NcpA, Config1, dc),
 3245:     {ok, CpB} = start_node_boot(NcpB, Config1, dc),
 3246:     {ok, CpC} = start_node_boot(NcpC, Config1, dc),
 3247:     {ok, CpD} = start_node_boot(NcpD, Config1, dc),
 3248:     {ok, CpE} = start_node_boot(NcpE, Config1, dc),
 3249:

 3251:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 3252:     pang = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping,
 3253: 		    [list_to_atom(lists:concat(["cp5@", M]))]),
 3254:     pong = rpc:call(Cp2, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 3255:     pang = rpc:call(Cp2, net_adm, ping,
 3256: 		    [list_to_atom(lists:concat(["cp5@", M]))]),

 3265:     pong = rpc:call(CpE, net_adm, ping, [CpD]),

 3269:                TestGG4_2 = rpc:call(CpB, global, whereis_name, [test]),

 3278:                (TestGG4_3 =:= TestGG4) and

 3583: 
 3584: gg_sync_and_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact) ->
 3585:     ok = rpc:call(Node, global_group, sync, []),
 3586:     gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact).
 3587: 
 3588: gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact) ->
 3589:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 3590:     try
 3591:         GGInfo = rpc:call(Node, global_group, info, []),
 3592:         ct:pal("GG info: ~p~n", [GGInfo]),
 3593:         case proplists:lookup(synced_nodes, GGInfo) of
 3594:             {synced_nodes, Synced} -> ok;
 3595:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3596:         end,
 3597:         case proplists:lookup(sync_error, GGInfo) of
 3598:             {sync_error, SyncError} -> ok;
 3599:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3600:         end,
 3601:         case proplists:lookup(no_contact, GGInfo) of
 3602:             {no_contact, NoContact} -> ok;
 3603:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3604:         end
 3605:     catch
 3606:         throw:wait ->
 3607:             gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact)
 3608:     end.
 3609: 
 3610: %%% Copied from init_SUITE.erl.
 3611: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
 3612:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
 3613:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,  "kernel-" ++ KernelVsn))
 3614: 	andalso
 3615: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,  "stdlib-" ++ StdlibVsn)).
 3616: 
 3617: create_script_dc(ScriptName) ->
 3618:     Name = filename:join(".", ScriptName),
 3619:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 3620:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
 3621:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
 3622:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 3623:     {_, Version} = init:script_id(),
 3624:     io:format(Fd,
 3625: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"~s\"}, \n"
 3626: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
 3627: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
 3628: 	      [Version, KernelVer, StdlibVer]),
 3629:     file:close(Fd),
 3630:     {KernelVer, StdlibVer}.

 3639: 	      "              ]}].~n",
 3640: 	      [Ncp1, M, Ncp2, M, Ncp3, M,  Ncp1, M, Ncp2, M, Ncp3, M]).
