 3680: start_procs(Parent, N1, N2, N3, Config) ->
 3681:     S1 = lists:sort([N1, N2, N3]),
 3682:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3683: 	       NN = lists:sort(nodes()),
 3684: 	       S1 =:= NN
 3685: 	   end),
 3686:     Pid3 = start_proc3(test1),
 3687:     Pid4 = rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test2]),
 3688:     assert_pid(Pid4),
 3689:     Pid5 = rpc:call(N2, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test3]),
 3690:     assert_pid(Pid5),
 3691:     Pid6 = rpc:call(N3, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test4]),
 3692:     assert_pid(Pid6),
 3693:     yes = global:register_name(test1, Pid3),
 3694:     yes = global:register_name(test2, Pid4, fun global:notify_all_name/3),
 3695:     yes = global:register_name(test3, Pid5, fun global:random_notify_name/3),
 3696:     Resolve = fun(Name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3697: 		      Parent ! {resolve_called, Name, node()},
 3698: 		      {Min, Max} = minmax(Pid1, Pid2),
 3699: 		      exit(Min, kill),
 3700: 		      Max
 3701: 	      end,
 3702:     yes = global:register_name(test4, Pid6, Resolve).
 3703: 
 3704: 
 3705: 
 3706: collect_resolves() -> cr(0).
 3707: cr(Res) ->
 3708:     receive
 3709: 	{resolve_called, Name, Node} ->
 3710: 	    ?P("resolve called: ~w ~w", [Name, Node]),
 3711:  	    cr(Res+1)
 3712:     after
 3713: 	0 -> Res
 3714:     end.
 3715: 
 3716: minmax(P1,P2) ->
 3717:     if node(P1) < node(P2) -> {P1, P2}; true -> {P2, P1} end.
 3718: 
 3719: fix_basic_name(name03, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3720:     case atom_to_list(node(Pid1)) of
 3721: 	[$c, $p, $3|_] -> exit(Pid2, kill), Pid1;
 3722: 	_ -> exit(Pid1, kill), Pid2
 3723:     end;
 3724: fix_basic_name(name12, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3725:     case atom_to_list(node(Pid1)) of
 3726: 	[$c, $p, $2|_] -> exit(Pid2, kill), Pid1;
 3727: 	_ -> exit(Pid1, kill), Pid2
 3728:     end.
 3729: 
 3730: start_proc() ->
 3731:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3732:     receive
 3733: 	Pid -> Pid
 3734:     end.
 3735: 
 3736: 
 3737: start_proc(Name) ->
 3738:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self(), Name]),
 3739:     receive
 3740: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 3741:     end.
 3742: 
 3743: start_proc2(Name) ->
 3744:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init2, [self(), Name]),
 3745:     receive
 3746: 	Pid -> Pid
 3747:     end.
 3748: 
 3749: start_proc3(Name) ->
 3750:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3751:     register(Name, Pid),
 3752:     receive
 3753: 	Pid -> Pid
 3754:     end.
 3755: 
 3756: start_proc4(Name) ->
 3757:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3758:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid),
 3759:     receive
 3760: 	Pid -> Pid
 3761:     end.
 3762: 
 3763: start_proc_basic(Name) ->
 3764:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, init_proc_basic, [self(), Name]),
 3765:     receive
 3766: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 3767:     end.
 3768: 
 3769: init_proc_basic(Parent, Name) ->
 3770:     X = global:register_name(Name, self(), fun ?MODULE:fix_basic_name/3),
 3771:     Parent ! {self(),X},
 3772:     loop().
 3773: 
 3774: single_node(Time, Node) ->
 3775:     spawn(?MODULE, init_2, []),
 3776:     timer:sleep(Time - msec()),
 3777:     _ = net_adm:ping(Node),
 3778:     ok.
 3779: 
 3780: init_2() ->
 3781:     register(single_name, self()),
 3782:     yes = global:register_name(single_name, self()),
 3783:     loop_2().
 3784: 
 3785: loop_2() ->
 3786:     receive
 3787: 	die -> ok
 3788:     end.
 3789: 
 3790: msec() ->
 3791:     msec(erlang:timestamp()).
 3792: 
 3793: msec(T) ->
 3794:     element(1,T)*1000000000 + element(2,T)*1000 + element(3,T) div 1000.
 3795: 
 3796: assert_pid(Pid) ->
 3797:     if
 3798: 	is_pid(Pid) -> true;
 3799: 	true -> exit({not_a_pid, Pid})
 3800:     end.
 3801: 
 3802: check_same([H|T]) -> check_same(T, H).
 3803: 
 3804: check_same([H|T], H) -> check_same(T, H);
 3805: check_same([], _H) -> ok.
 3806: 
 3807: check_same_p([H|T]) -> check_same_p(T, H).
 3808: 
 3809: check_same_p([H|T], H) -> check_same_p(T, H);
 3810: check_same_p([], _H) -> true;
 3811: check_same_p(_, _) -> false.
 3812: 
 3813: p_init(Parent) ->
 3814:     Parent ! self(),
 3815:     loop().
 3816: 
 3817: p_init(Parent, Name) ->
 3818:     X = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 3819:     Parent ! {self(),X},
 3820:     loop().
 3821: 
 3822: p_init2(Parent, Name) ->
 3823:     _ = global:re_register_name(Name, self()),
 3824:     Parent ! self(),
 3825:     loop().
 3826: 
 3827: req(Pid, Msg) ->
 3828:     Pid ! Msg,
 3829:     receive X -> X end.
 3830: 
 3831: sreq(Pid, Msg) ->
 3832:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3833:     Pid ! {Msg, Ref},
 3834:     receive {Ref, X} -> X end.
 3835: 
 3836: alone(N1, N2) ->
 3837:     ct:sleep(12000),
 3838:     net_adm:ping(N1),
 3839:     net_adm:ping(N2),
 3840:     yes = global:register_name(test5, self()).
 3841: 
 3842: crash(Time) ->
 3843:     %% ct:sleep/1 will not work because it calls a server process
 3844:     %% that does not run on other nodes.
 3845:     timer:sleep(Time),
 3846:     erlang:halt().
 3847: 
 3848: loop() ->
 3849:     receive
 3850: 	{ping, From} ->
 3851: 	    From ! {pong, node()},
 3852: 	    loop();
 3853: 	{del_lock, Id} ->
 3854: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}),
 3855: 	    loop();
 3856: 	{del_lock_sync, Id, From} ->
 3857: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}),
 3858: 	    From ! true,
 3859: 	    loop();
 3860: 	{del_lock, Id, Nodes} ->
 3861: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}, Nodes),
 3862: 	    loop();
 3863: 	{del_lock2, Id, From} ->
 3864: 	    global:del_lock(Id),
 3865: 	    From ! true,
 3866: 	    loop();
 3867: 	{del_lock2, Id, From, Nodes} ->
 3868: 	    global:del_lock(Id, Nodes),
 3869: 	    From ! true,
 3870: 	    loop();
 3871: 	{set_lock, Id, From} ->
 3872: 	    Res = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
 3873: 	    From ! Res,
 3874: 	    loop();
 3875: 	{set_lock, Id, From, Nodes} ->
 3876: 	    Res = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, Nodes, 1),
 3877: 	    From ! Res,
 3878: 	    loop();
 3879: 	{set_lock_loop, Id, From} ->
 3880: 	    true = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, ?NODES),
 3881: 	    From ! {got_lock, self()},
 3882: 	    loop();
 3883: 	{set_lock2, Id, From} ->
 3884: 	    Res = global:set_lock(Id, ?NODES, 1),
 3885: 	    From ! Res,
 3886: 	    loop();
 3887: 	{{got_notify, From}, Ref} ->
 3888: 	    receive
 3889: 		X when element(1, X) =:= global_name_conflict ->
 3890: 		    From ! {Ref, yes}
 3891: 	    after
 3892: 		0 -> From ! {Ref, no}
 3893: 	    end,
 3894: 	    loop();
 3895: 	die ->
 3896: 	    exit(normal);
 3897: 	drop_dead ->
 3898: 	    exit(drop_dead)
 3899:     end.
 3900: 
 3901: -ifdef(unused).
 3902: pr_diff(Str, T0, T1) ->
 3903:     Diff = begin
 3904: 	       {_, {H,M,S}} = calendar:time_difference(T0, T1),
 3905: 	       ((H*60+M)*60)+S
 3906: 	   end,
 3907:     ct:pal(?HI_VERBOSITY,"~13s: ~w (diff: ~w)",[Str, T1, Diff]),
 3908:     if
 3909: 	Diff > 100 ->
 3910: 	    io:format(1,"~s: ** LARGE DIFF ~w~n", [Str, Diff]);
 3911: 	true -> 
 3912: 	    ok
 3913:     end.
 3914: -endif.	    
 3915: 
 3916: now_diff({A1,B1,C1},{A2,B2,C2}) ->
 3917:     C1-C2 + 1000000*((B1-B2) + 1000000*(A1-A2)).
 3918: 
 3919: start_node_boot(Name, Config, Boot) ->
 3920:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3921:     Res = test_server:start_node(Name, peer, [{args, " -pa " ++ Pa ++ 
 3922: 						   " -config " ++ Config ++
 3923: 						   " -boot " ++ atom_to_list(Boot)}]),
 3924:     record_started_node(Res).
 3925: 
 3926: %% Increase the timeout for when an upcoming connection is teared down
 3927: %% again (default is 7 seconds, and can be exceeded by some tests).
 3928: %% The default remains in effect for the test_server node itself, though.
 3929: start_node(Name, Config) ->
 3930:     start_node(Name, slave, Config).
 3931: 
 3932: start_hidden_node(Name, Config) ->
 3933:     start_node(Name, slave, "-hidden", Config).
 3934: 
 3935: start_non_connecting_node(Name, Config) ->
 3936:     start_node(Name, slave, "-connect_all false +W i", Config).
 3937: 
 3938: start_peer_node(Name, Config) ->
 3939:     start_node(Name, peer, Config).
 3940: 
 3941: start_node(Name, How, Config) ->
 3942:     start_node(Name, How, "", Config).
 3943: 
 3944: start_node(Name0, How, Args, Config) ->
 3945:     Name = node_name(Name0, Config),
 3946:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3947:     R = test_server:start_node(
 3948:           Name, How, [{args,
 3949:                        Args ++
 3950:                            " -kernel net_setuptime 100 " ++
 3951:                            %% Limit the amount of threads so that we
 3952:                            %% don't run into the maximum allowed
 3953:                            " +S 1 +SDio 1 " ++
 3954:                            %% "-noshell "
 3955:                            "-pa " ++ Pa},
 3956:                       {linked, false}
 3957:                      ]),
 3958:     %% {linked,false} only seems to work for slave nodes.
 3959:     %%    ct:sleep(1000),
 3960:     record_started_node(R).
 3961: 
 3962: start_node_rel(Name0, Rel, Config) ->
 3963:     Name = node_name(Name0, Config),
 3964:     {Release, Compat} = case Rel of
 3965:                             this ->
 3966:                                 {[this], ""};
 3967:                             Rel when is_atom(Rel) ->
 3968:                                 {[{release, atom_to_list(Rel)}], ""};
 3969:                             RelList ->
 3970: 				{RelList, ""}
 3971: 			end,
 3972:     Env = [],
 3973:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3974:     Res = test_server:start_node(
 3975:             Name, peer,
 3976:             [{args,
 3977:               Compat ++
 3978:                   " -kernel net_setuptime 100 " ++
 3979:                   %% Limit the amount of threads so that we
 3980:                   %% don't run into the maximum allowed
 3981:                   " +S 1 +SDio 1 " ++
 3982:                   "-pa " ++ Pa},
 3983:              {erl, Release}] ++ Env),
 3984:     record_started_node(Res).
 3985: 
 3986: record_started_node({ok, Node}) ->
 3987:     node_started(Node),
 3988:     case erase(?nodes_tag) of
 3989:         undefined -> ok;
 3990:         Nodes -> put(?nodes_tag, [Node | Nodes])
 3991:     end,
 3992:     {ok, Node};
 3993: record_started_node(R) ->
 3994:     R.
 3995: 
 3996: node_names(Names, Config) ->
 3997:     [node_name(Name, Config) || Name <- Names].
 3998: 
 3999: %% simple_resolve assumes that the node name comes first.
 4000: node_name(Name, Config) ->
 4001:     U = "_",
 4002:     {{Y,M,D}, {H,Min,S}} = calendar:now_to_local_time(erlang:timestamp()),
 4003:     Date = io_lib:format("~4w_~2..0w_~2..0w__~2..0w_~2..0w_~2..0w", 
 4004:                          [Y,M,D, H,Min,S]),
 4005:     L = lists:flatten(Date),
 4006:     lists:concat([Name,U,?testcase,U,U,L]).
 4007: 
 4008: stop_nodes(Nodes) ->
 4009:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) -> stop_node(Node) end, Nodes).
 4010: 
 4011: stop_node(Node) ->
 4012:     Res = test_server:stop_node(Node),
 4013:     node_stopped(Node),
 4014:     Res.
 4015: 
 4016: 
 4017: stop() ->
 4018:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
 4019: 			  test_server:stop_node(Node),
 4020:                           node_stopped(Node)
 4021: 		  end, nodes()).
 4022: 
 4023: %% Tests that locally loaded nodes do not loose contact with other nodes.
 4024: global_lost_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4025:     Timeout = 60,
 4026:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4027:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4028:     init_condition(Config),
 4029: 
 4030:     {ok, Node1} = start_node(node1, Config),
 4031:     {ok, Node2} = start_node(node2, Config),
 4032: 
 4033:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4034: 
 4035:     io:format("Nodes: ~p", [nodes()]),
 4036:     io:format("Nodes at node1: ~p",
 4037: 	      [rpc:call(Node1, erlang, nodes, [])]),
 4038:     io:format("Nodes at node2: ~p",
 4039: 	      [rpc:call(Node2, erlang, nodes, [])]),
 4040: 
 4041:     rpc_cast(Node1, ?MODULE, global_load, [node_1,Node2,node_2]),
 4042:     rpc_cast(Node2, ?MODULE, global_load, [node_2,Node1,node_1]),
 4043: 
 4044:     lost_nodes_waiter(Node1, Node2),
 4045: 
 4046:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4047:     stop_node(Node1),
 4048:     stop_node(Node2),
 4049:     init_condition(Config),
 4050:     ok.    
 4051: 
 4052: global_load(MyName, OtherNode, OtherName) ->
 4053:     yes = global:register_name(MyName, self()),
 4054:     io:format("Registered ~p",[MyName]),
 4055:     global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, 0).
 4056: 
 4057: global_load1(_OtherNode, _OtherName, 2) ->
 4058:     io:format("*** ~p giving up. No use.", [node()]),
 4059:     init:stop();
 4060: global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails) ->	
 4061:     ct:sleep(1000),
 4062:     case catch global:whereis_name(OtherName) of
 4063: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 4064: 	    io:format("~p says: ~p is still there.",
 4065: 		      [node(),OtherName]),
 4066: 	    global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails);
 4067: 	Other ->
 4068: 	    io:format("~p says: ~p is lost (~p) Pinging.",
 4069: 		      [ node(), OtherName, Other]),
 4070: 	    case net_adm:ping(OtherNode) of
 4071: 		pong ->
 4072: 		    io:format("Re-established contact to ~p",
 4073: 			      [OtherName]);
 4074: 		pang ->
 4075: 		    io:format("PANIC! Other node is DEAD.", []),
 4076: 		    init:stop()
 4077: 	    end,
 4078: 	    global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails+1)
 4079:     end.
 4080: 
 4081: lost_nodes_waiter(N1, N2) ->
 4082:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 4083:     receive
 4084: 	{nodedown, Node} when Node =:= N1 ; Node =:= N2 ->
 4085: 	    io:format("~p went down!",[Node]),
 4086: 	    ct:fail("Node went down.")
 4087:     after 10000 ->
 4088: 	    ok
 4089:     end,
 4090:     ok.
 4091: 
 4092: 
 4093: 
 4094: %% Tests the simultaneous death of many processes with registered names.
 4095: mass_death(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4096:     Timeout = 90,
 4097:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4098:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4099:     init_condition(Config),
 4100:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4101:     %% Start nodes
 4102:     Cps = [cp1,cp2,cp3,cp4,cp5],
 4103:     Nodes = [begin {ok, Node} = start_node(Cp, Config), Node end ||
 4104: 		Cp <- Cps],
 4105:     io:format("Nodes: ~p~n", [Nodes]),
 4106:     Ns = lists:seq(1, 40),
 4107:     %% Start processes with globally registered names on the nodes
 4108:     {Pids,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, ?MODULE, init_mass_spawn, [Ns]),
 4109:     io:format("Pids: ~p~n", [Pids]),
 4110:     %% Wait...
 4111:     ct:sleep(10000),
 4112:     %% Check the globally registered names
 4113:     NewNames = global:registered_names(),
 4114:     io:format("NewNames: ~p~n", [NewNames]),
 4115:     Ndiff = lists:sort(NewNames--OrigNames),
 4116:     io:format("Ndiff: ~p~n", [Ndiff]),
 4117:     Ndiff = lists:sort(mass_names(Nodes, Ns)),
 4118:     %%
 4119:     %% Kill the root pids
 4120:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) -> Pid ! drop_dead end, Pids),
 4121:     %% Start probing and wait for all registered names to disappear
 4122:     {YYYY,MM,DD} = date(),
 4123:     {H,M,S} = time(),
 4124:     io:format("Started probing: ~.4.0w-~.2.0w-~.2.0w ~.2.0w:~.2.0w:~.2.0w~n",
 4125: 	      [YYYY,MM,DD,H,M,S]),
 4126:     wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, erlang:timestamp(), Config).
 4127: 
 4128: wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, Then, Config) ->
 4129:     Names = global:registered_names(),
 4130:     case Names--OrigNames of
 4131: 	[] ->
 4132: 	    T = now_diff(erlang:timestamp(), Then) div 1000,
 4133: 	    lists:foreach(
 4134: 	      fun (Node) ->
 4135: 		      stop_node(Node)
 4136: 	      end, Nodes),
 4137: 	    init_condition(Config),
 4138: 	    {comment,lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~.3f s~n", [T/1000.0]))};
 4139: 	Ndiff ->
 4140: 	    io:format("Ndiff: ~p~n", [Ndiff]),
 4141: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
 4142: 	    wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, Then, Config)
 4143:     end.
 4144: 
 4145: init_mass_spawn(N) ->
 4146:     Pid = mass_spawn(N),
 4147:     unlink(Pid),
 4148:     Pid.
 4149: 
 4150: mass_spawn([]) ->
 4151:     ok;
 4152: mass_spawn([N|T]) ->
 4153:     Parent = self(),
 4154:     Pid = 
 4155: 	spawn_link(
 4156: 	  fun () ->
 4157: 		  Name = mass_name(node(), N),
 4158: 		  yes = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 4159: 		  mass_spawn(T),
 4160: 		  Parent ! self(),
 4161: 		  loop()
 4162: 	  end),
 4163:     receive
 4164:         Pid ->
 4165:             Pid
 4166:     end.
 4167: 
 4168: mass_names([], _) ->
 4169:     [];
 4170: mass_names([Node|T],Ns) ->
 4171:     [mass_name(Node, N) || N <- Ns] ++ mass_names(T, Ns).
 4172: 
 4173: mass_name(Node, N) ->
 4174:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Node)++"_"++integer_to_list(N)).
 4175: 
 4176: 
 4177: 
 4178: start_nodes(L, How, Config) ->
 4179:     start_nodes2(L, How, 0, Config),
 4180:     Nodes = collect_nodes(0, length(L)),
 4181:     ?UNTIL([] =:= Nodes -- nodes()),
 4182:     put(?nodes_tag, Nodes),
 4183:     %% Pinging doesn't help, we have to wait too, for nodes() to become
 4184:     %% correct on the other node.
 4185:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
 4186: 			  net_adm:ping(E)
 4187: 		  end,
 4188: 		  Nodes),
 4189:     verify_nodes(Nodes, Config),
 4190:     Nodes.
 4191: 
 4192: %% Not used?
 4193: start_nodes_serially([], _, _Config) ->
 4194:     [];
 4195: start_nodes_serially([Name | Rest], How, Config) ->
 4196:     {ok, R} = start_node(Name, How, Config),
 4197:     [R | start_nodes_serially(Rest, How, Config)].
 4198: 
 4199: verify_nodes(Nodes, Config) ->
 4200:     verify_nodes(Nodes, lists:sort([node() | Nodes]), Config).
 4201: 
 4202: verify_nodes([], _N, _Config) ->
 4203:     [];
 4204: verify_nodes([Node | Rest], N, Config) ->
 4205:     ?UNTIL(
 4206:        case rpc:call(Node, erlang, nodes, []) of
 4207: 	   Nodes when is_list(Nodes) ->
 4208: 	       case N =:= lists:sort([Node | Nodes]) of
 4209: 		   true ->
 4210: 		       true;
 4211: 		   false ->
 4212: 		       lists:foreach(fun(Nd) ->
 4213: 					     rpc:call(Nd, net_adm, ping,
 4214:                                                       [Node])
 4215: 				     end,
 4216: 				     nodes()),
 4217: 		       false
 4218: 	       end;
 4219: 	   _ ->
 4220: 	       false
 4221:        end
 4222:       ),
 4223:     verify_nodes(Rest, N, Config).
 4224: 
 4225: 
 4226: start_nodes2([], _How, _, _Config) ->
 4227:     [];
 4228: start_nodes2([Name | Rest], How, N, Config) ->
 4229:     Self = self(),
 4230:     spawn(fun() ->
 4231: 		  erlang:display({starting, Name}),
 4232: 		  {ok, R} = start_node(Name, How, Config),
 4233: 		  erlang:display({started, Name, R}),
 4234: 		  Self ! {N, R},
 4235: 		  %% sleeping is necessary, or with peer nodes, they will
 4236: 		  %% go down again, despite {linked, false}.
 4237: 		  ct:sleep(100000)
 4238: 	  end),
 4239:     start_nodes2(Rest, How, N+1, Config).
 4240: 
 4241: collect_nodes(N, N) ->
 4242:     [];
 4243: collect_nodes(N, Max) ->
 4244:     receive
 4245: 	{N, Node} ->
 4246:             [Node | collect_nodes(N+1, Max)]
 4247:     end.
 4248: 
 4249: exit_p(Pid) ->
 4250:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4251:     Pid ! die,
 4252:     receive
 4253: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4254: 	    ok
 4255:     end.
 4256: 
 4257: wait_for_exit(Pid) ->
 4258:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4259:     receive
 4260: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4261: 	    ok
 4262:     end.
 4263: 
 4264: wait_for_exit_fast(Pid) ->
 4265:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4266:     receive
 4267: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4268: 	    ok
 4269:     end.
 4270: 
 4271: check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config) ->
 4272:     ?UNTIL(begin
 4273: 	       case rpc:multicall(Nodes, global, whereis_name, [Name]) of
 4274: 		   {Ns1, []} ->
 4275: 		       check_same_p(Ns1);
 4276: 		   _R ->
 4277: 		       false
 4278: 	       end
 4279: 	   end).
 4280: 
 4281: init_condition(Config) ->
 4282:     io:format("globally registered names: ~p~n", [global:registered_names()]),
 4283:     io:format("nodes: ~p~n", [nodes()]),
 4284:     io:format("known: ~p~n", [get_known(node()) -- [node()]]),
 4285:     io:format("Info ~p~n", [setelement(10, global:info(), trace)]),
 4286:     _ = [io:format("~s: ~p~n", [TN, ets:tab2list(T)]) ||
 4287:             {TN, T} <- [{"Global Names     (ETS)", global_names},
 4288:                         {"Global Names Ext (ETS)", global_names_ext},
 4289:                         {"Global Locks     (ETS)", global_locks},
 4290:                         {"Global Pid Names (ETS)", global_pid_names},
 4291:                         {"Global Pid Ids   (ETS)", global_pid_ids}]],
 4292:     ?UNTIL([] =:= global:registered_names()),
 4293:     ?UNTIL([] =:= nodes()),
 4294:     ?UNTIL([node()] =:= get_known(node())),
 4295:     ok.
 4296: 
 4297: mk_node(N, H) when is_list(N), is_list(H) ->
 4298:     list_to_atom(N ++ "@" ++ H).
 4299: 
 4300: remove_gg_pub_type([]) ->
 4301:     [];
 4302: remove_gg_pub_type([{GG, Nodes}|Rest]) ->
 4303:     [{GG, Nodes}|remove_gg_pub_type(Rest)];
 4304: remove_gg_pub_type([{GG, _, Nodes}|Rest]) ->
 4305:     [{GG, Nodes}|remove_gg_pub_type(Rest)].
 4306: 
 4307: %% Send garbage message to all processes that are linked to global.
 4308: %% Better do this in a slave node.
 4309: %% (The transition from links to monitors does not affect this case.)
 4310: 
 4311: garbage_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4312:     Timeout = 25,
 4313:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4314:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4315:     init_condition(Config),
 4316:     [Slave] = start_nodes([garbage_messages], slave, Config),
 4317:     Fun = fun() ->
 4318: 		  {links,L} = process_info(whereis(global_name_server), links),
 4319: 		  lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! {garbage,to,you} end, L),
 4320: 		  receive
 4321: 		      _Any -> ok
 4322: 		  end
 4323: 	  end,
 4324:     Pid = spawn_link(Slave, erlang, apply, [Fun,[]]),
 4325:     ct:sleep(2000),
 4326:     Global = rpc:call(Slave, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]),
 4327:     {registered_name,global_name_server} =
 4328: 	rpc:call(Slave, erlang, process_info, [Global,registered_name]),
 4329:     true = unlink(Pid),
 4330:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4331:     stop_node(Slave),
 4332:     init_condition(Config),
 4333:     ok.
 4334: 
 4335: %% This is scenario outlined in
 4336: %% https://erlang.org/pipermail/erlang-questions/2020-October/100034.html.
 4337: %% It illustrates that the algorithm of Global is flawed.
 4338: %%
 4339: %% This has been worked around by global actively disconnecting nodes
 4340: %% to prevent overlapping partitions (OTP-17843).
 4341: flaw1(Config) ->
 4342:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
 4343:         true ->
 4344:             flaw1_test(Config);
 4345:         false ->
 4346:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
 4347:     end.
 4348: 
 4349: flaw1_test(Config) ->
 4350:     Timeout = 360,
 4351:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4352:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4353:     init_condition(Config),
 4354:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4355: 
 4356:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 4357: 
 4358:     [A, B, C, D] = OtherNodes = start_nodes([a, b, c, d], peer, Config),
 4359:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | OtherNodes]),
 4360:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4361: 
 4362:     F1 =
 4363:         fun(S0) ->
 4364:                 ct:sleep(100),
 4365:                 Str = "************",
 4366:                 S = Str ++ "  " ++ lists:flatten(S0) ++ "  " ++ Str,
 4367:                 io:format("~s\n", [S]),
 4368:                 erpc:call(
 4369:                   PartCtrlr,
 4370:                   fun () ->
 4371:                           [begin
 4372:                                RNs = erpc:call(N, global, registered_names, []),
 4373:                                W = erpc:call(N, global, whereis_name, [x]),
 4374:                                io:format("   === ~w ===\n", [N]),
 4375:                                io:format("       registered names: ~p", [RNs]),
 4376:                                io:format("       where is x:       ~p", [W])
 4377:                            end || N <- OtherNodes]
 4378:                   end)
 4379:         end,
 4380:     F1("start"),
 4381: 
 4382:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, A, C),
 4383:     F1("after disconnecting c from a"),
 4384: 
 4385:     Me = self(),
 4386:     IdleFun = fun () ->
 4387:                       Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Me),
 4388:                       receive
 4389:                           {'DOWN', Mon, process, Me, _} ->
 4390:                               exit(normal)
 4391:                       end
 4392:               end,
 4393:     Pid = spawn(IdleFun),
 4394:     yes = rpc:call(A, global, register_name, [x, Pid]),
 4395:     F1(io_lib:format("after registering x as ~p on a", [Pid])),
 4396: 
 4397:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, B, D),
 4398:     F1("after disconnecting d from b"),
 4399: 
 4400:     Pid2 = spawn(IdleFun),
 4401:     yes = rpc:call(B, global, re_register_name, [x, Pid2]),
 4402:     F1(io_lib:format("after re_register_name x as ~p on b", [Pid2])),
 4403: 
 4404:     pong = rpc:call(A, net_adm, ping, [C]),
 4405:     F1("finished after ping c from a"),
 4406: 
 4407:     pong = rpc:call(B, net_adm, ping, [D]),
 4408:     F1("finished after ping d from b"),
 4409: 
 4410:     timer:sleep(1000),
 4411: 
 4412:     check_everywhere(Nodes, x, Config),
 4413:     F1("After check everywhere"),
 4414: 
 4415:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(x)),
 4416: 
 4417:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 4418: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 4419: 		  end, Nodes),
 4420:     _ = rpc:call(A, global, unregister_name, [x]),
 4421: 
 4422:     F1("after unregistering x on node a"),
 4423: 
 4424:     %% _ = rpc:call(B, global, unregister_name, [y]),
 4425:     %% F1("after unregistering y on node b"),
 4426: 
 4427:     ct:sleep(100),
 4428:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4429:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4430:     stop_nodes(OtherNodes),
 4431:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 4432:     init_condition(Config),
 4433:     ok.
 4434: 
 4435: global_disconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4436:     Timeout = 30,
 4437:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4438: 
 4439:     [] = nodes(connected),
 4440: 
 4441:     {ok, H1} = start_hidden_node(h1, Config),
 4442:     {ok, H2} = start_hidden_node(h2, Config),
 4443:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, peer, Config),
 4444:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, peer, Config),
 4445:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, peer, Config),
 4446: 
 4447:     ThisNode = node(),
 4448:     HNodes = lists:sort([H1, H2]),
 4449:     OtherGNodes = lists:sort([Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]),
 4450:     AllGNodes = lists:sort([ThisNode|OtherGNodes]),
 4451: 
 4452:     lists:foreach(fun (Node) -> pong = net_adm:ping(Node) end, OtherGNodes),
 4453: 
 4454:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4455: 
 4456:     ok = erpc:call(
 4457:            H2,
 4458:            fun () ->
 4459:                    lists:foreach(fun (Node) ->
 4460:                                          pong = net_adm:ping(Node)
 4461:                                  end, OtherGNodes)
 4462:            end),
 4463: 
 4464:     lists:foreach(
 4465:       fun (Node) ->
 4466:               AllGNodes = erpc:call(
 4467:                             H1,
 4468:                             fun () ->
 4469:                                     erpc:call(
 4470:                                       Node,
 4471:                                       fun () ->
 4472:                                               lists:sort([node()|nodes()])
 4473:                                       end)
 4474:                             end),
 4475:               HNodes = erpc:call(
 4476:                          H1,
 4477:                          fun () ->
 4478:                                  erpc:call(
 4479:                                    Node,
 4480:                                    fun () ->
 4481:                                            lists:sort(nodes(hidden))
 4482:                                    end)
 4483:                          end)
 4484:       end, AllGNodes),
 4485: 
 4486:     OtherGNodes = lists:sort(global:disconnect()),
 4487: 
 4488:     GNodesAfterDisconnect = nodes(),
 4489: 
 4490:     HNodes = lists:sort(nodes(hidden)),
 4491: 
 4492:     lists:foreach(fun (Node) ->
 4493:                           false = lists:member(Node, GNodesAfterDisconnect)
 4494:                   end,
 4495:                   OtherGNodes),
 4496: 
 4497:     %% Wait a while giving the other nodes time to react to the disconnects
 4498:     %% before we check that everything is as expected...
 4499:     receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 4500: 
 4501:     lists:foreach(
 4502:       fun (Node) ->
 4503:               OtherGNodes = erpc:call(
 4504:                               H1,
 4505:                               fun () ->
 4506:                                       erpc:call(
 4507:                                         Node,
 4508:                                         fun () ->
 4509:                                                 lists:sort([node()|nodes()])
 4510:                                         end)
 4511:                               end),
 4512:               HNodes = erpc:call(
 4513:                          H1,
 4514:                          fun () ->
 4515:                                  erpc:call(
 4516:                                    Node,
 4517:                                    fun () ->
 4518:                                            lists:sort(nodes(hidden))
 4519:                                    end)
 4520:                          end)
 4521:       end, OtherGNodes),
 4522: 
 4523:     stop_node(Cp1),
 4524:     stop_node(Cp2),
 4525:     stop_node(Cp3),
 4526:     stop_node(H1),
 4527:     stop_node(H2),
 4528: 
 4529:     ok.
 4530: 
 4531: %% ---
 4532: 
 4533: wait_for_ready_net(Config) ->
 4534:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 4535:                                         wait_for_ready_net(?NODES, Config)
 4536:                                 end),
 4537:     wait_for_ready_net_loop(Pid, MRef).
 4538: 
 4539: wait_for_ready_net_loop(Pid, MRef) ->
 4540:     receive
 4541:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} ->
 4542:             ?P("wait-for-ready-net process terminated: "
 4543:                "~n      ~p", [Info]),
 4544:             ok;
 4545: 
 4546:         {'EXIT', ParentPid, {timetrap_timeout, _Timeout, _Stack}} ->
 4547:             ?P("wait-for-ready-net -> received timetrap timeout:"
 4548:                "~n   Regarding: ~p"
 4549:                "~n   Waiter:    ~p"
 4550:                "~n      Current Location: ~p"
 4551:                "~n      Dictionary:       ~p"
 4552:                "~n      Messages:          ~p",
 4553:                [ParentPid, Pid,
 4554:                 pi(Pid, current_location),
 4555:                 pi(Pid, dictionary),
 4556:                 pi(Pid, messages)]),
 4557:             exit(Pid, kill),
 4558:             ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ready network")
 4559: 
 4560:     end.
 4561: 
 4562: wait_for_ready_net(Nodes0, Config) ->
 4563:     Nodes = lists:sort(Nodes0),
 4564:     ?P("wait_for_ready_net ->"
 4565:        "~n   Nodes: ~p", [Nodes]),
 4566:     ?UNTIL(begin
 4567:                lists:all(fun(N) ->
 4568:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4569:                                     "get known (by global) for ~p", [N]),
 4570:                                  GNs = get_known(N),
 4571:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> verify same for ~p:"
 4572:                                     "~n   Global Known: ~p"
 4573:                                     "~n   Nodes:        ~p", [N, GNs, Nodes]),
 4574:                                  GRes = Nodes =:= GNs,
 4575:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net => ~p", [GRes]),
 4576:                                  GRes
 4577:                          end,
 4578:                          Nodes) and
 4579: 		   lists:all(fun(N) ->
 4580:                                      ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4581:                                         "get erlang nodes for ~p", [N]),
 4582: 				     case rpc:call(N, erlang, nodes, []) of
 4583:                                          RNs0 when is_list(RNs0) ->
 4584:                                              RNs = lists:sort([N | RNs0]),
 4585:                                              ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4586:                                                 "verify same for ~p: "
 4587:                                                 "~n   Remote nodes:  ~p"
 4588:                                                 "~n   (Local) Nodes: ~p",
 4589:                                                 [N, RNs, Nodes]),
 4590:                                              ERes = Nodes =:= RNs,
 4591:                                              ?P("wait_for_ready_net => ~p",
 4592:                                                 [ERes]),
 4593:                                              ERes;
 4594:                                          BadRes ->
 4595:                                              ?P("failed get nodes for ~p"
 4596:                                                 "~n      ~p",
 4597:                                                 [N, BadRes]),
 4598:                                              false
 4599:                                      end
 4600: 			     end,
 4601:                              Nodes)
 4602:            end).
 4603: 
 4604: get_known(Node) ->
 4605:     case catch gen_server:call({global_name_server,Node},get_known,infinity) of
 4606:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4607:             [list, without, nodenames];
 4608:         Known when is_list(Known) -> 
 4609:             lists:sort([Node | Known])
 4610:     end.
 4611: 
 4612: quite_a_few_nodes(Max) ->
 4613:     N = try 
 4614:             ulimit("ulimit -u")
 4615:         catch _:_ ->
 4616: 		ulimit("ulimit -p") % can fail...
 4617:         end,
 4618:     lists:min([(N - 40) div 3, Max]).
 4619: 
 4620: ulimit(Cmd) ->
 4621:     N0 = os:cmd(Cmd),
 4622:     N1 = lists:reverse(N0),
 4623:     N2 = lists:dropwhile(fun($\r) -> true;
 4624: 			    ($\n) -> true;
 4625: 			    (_) -> false
 4626: 			 end, N1),
 4627:     case lists:reverse(N2) of
 4628:         "unlimited" -> 10000;
 4629:         N -> list_to_integer(N)
 4630:     end.
 4631: 
 4632: %% To make it less probable that some low-level problem causes
 4633: %% problems, the receiving node is ping:ed.
 4634: rpc_cast(Node, Module, Function, Args) ->
 4635:     {_,pong,Node}= {node(),net_adm:ping(Node),Node},
 4636:     rpc:cast(Node, Module, Function, Args).
 4637: 
 4638: global_known(Node) ->
 4639:     gen_server:call({global_name_server, Node}, get_known, infinity).
 4640: 
 4641: global_known() ->
 4642:     global_known(node()).
 4643: 
 4644: disconnect(Node) ->
 4645:     erlang:disconnect_node(Node),
 4646:     wait_until(fun () -> not lists:member(Node, global_known()) end),
 4647:     ok.
 4648: 
 4649: disconnect_nodes(HiddenCtrlNode, NodeA, NodeB) ->
 4650:     Nodes = [node()|nodes()],
 4651:     ok = erpc:call(HiddenCtrlNode,
 4652:                    fun () ->
 4653:                            ok = erpc:call(NodeA,
 4654:                                           fun () ->
 4655:                                                   disconnect(NodeB)
 4656:                                           end),
 4657:                            ok = erpc:call(NodeB,
 4658:                                           fun () ->
 4659:                                                   disconnect(NodeA)
 4660:                                           end),
 4661:                            %% Try to ensure 'lost_connection' messages
 4662:                            %% have been handled (see comment in
 4663:                            %% create_partitions)...
 4664:                            lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 4665:                                                  _ = global_known(N)
 4666:                                          end, Nodes),
 4667:                            ok
 4668:                    end).
 4669: 
 4670: create_partitions(PartitionsList) ->
 4671:     AllNodes = lists:sort(lists:flatten(PartitionsList)),
 4672: 
 4673:     %% Take down all connections on all nodes...
 4674:     AllOk = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, AllNodes),
 4675:     io:format("Disconnecting all nodes from eachother...", []),
 4676:     AllOk = erpc:multicall(
 4677:               AllNodes,
 4678:               fun () ->
 4679:                       lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 4680:                                             erlang:disconnect_node(N)
 4681:                                     end, nodes()),
 4682:                       wait_until(fun () -> [] == global_known() end),
 4683:                       ok
 4684:               end, 5000),
 4685:     %% Here we know that all 'lost_connection' messages that will be
 4686:     %% sent by global name servers due to these disconnects have been
 4687:     %% sent, but we don't know that all of them have been received and
 4688:     %% handled. By communicating with all global name servers one more
 4689:     %% time it is very likely that all of them have been received and
 4690:     %% handled (however, not guaranteed). If 'lost_connection' messages
 4691:     %% are received after we begin to set up the partitions, the
 4692:     %% partitions may lose connection with some of its nodes.
 4693:     lists:foreach(fun (N) -> [] = global_known(N) end, AllNodes),
 4694: 
 4695:     %% Set up fully connected partitions...
 4696:     io:format("Connecting partitions...", []),
 4697:     lists:foreach(
 4698:       fun (Partition) ->
 4699:               Part = lists:sort(Partition),
 4700:               PartOk = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, Part),
 4701:               PartOk = erpc:multicall(
 4702:                          Part,
 4703:                          fun () ->
 4704:                                  wait_until(
 4705:                                    fun () ->
 4706:                                            ConnNodes = Part -- [node()|nodes()],
 4707:                                            if ConnNodes == [] ->
 4708:                                                    true;
 4709:                                               true ->
 4710:                                                    lists:foreach(
 4711:                                                      fun (N) ->
 4712:                                                              net_kernel:connect_node(N)
 4713:                                                      end, ConnNodes),
 4714:                                                    false
 4715:                                            end
 4716:                                    end),
 4717:                                  ok
 4718:                                                         
 4719:                          end, 5000)
 4720:       end, PartitionsList),
 4721:     ok.
 4722:                                                      
 4723: setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, PartList) when is_atom(PartCtrlr) ->
 4724:     ok = erpc:call(PartCtrlr, fun () -> create_partitions(PartList) end),
 4725:     io:format("Partitions successfully setup:~n", []),
 4726:     lists:foreach(fun (Part) ->
 4727:                           io:format("~p~n", [Part])
 4728:                   end,
 4729:                   PartList),
 4730:     ok;
 4731: setup_partitions(Config, PartList) when is_list(Config) ->
 4732:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 4733:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, PartList),
 4734:     PartCtrlr.
 4735: 
 4736: start_partition_controller(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4737:     {ok, PartCtrlr} = start_hidden_node(part_ctrlr, Config),
 4738:     PartCtrlr.
 4739: 
 4740: stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr) ->
 4741:     stop_node(PartCtrlr).
 4742: 
 4743: prevent_overlapping_partitions() ->
 4744:     case application:get_env(kernel, prevent_overlapping_partitions) of
 4745:         {ok, false} ->
 4746:             false;
 4747:         _ ->
 4748:             true
 4749:     end.
 4750: 
 4751: cast_line([]) ->
 4752:     ok;
 4753: cast_line([N|Ns]) when N == node() ->
 4754:     cast_line(Ns);
 4755: cast_line([N|Ns]) ->
 4756:     erpc:cast(N, fun () -> cast_line(Ns) end).
 4757:                          
 4758: wait_until(F) ->
 4759:     case catch F() of
 4760:         true ->
 4761:             ok;
 4762:         _ ->
 4763:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 4764:             wait_until(F)
 4765:     end.
 4766: 
 4767: 
 4768: %% The emulator now ensures that the node has been removed from
 4769: %% nodes().
 4770: rpc_disconnect_node(Node, DisconnectedNode, Config) ->
 4771:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, disconnect_node, [DisconnectedNode]),
 4772:     ?UNTIL
 4773:       (not lists:member(DisconnectedNode, rpc:call(Node, erlang, nodes, []))).
 4774: 
 4775: %%%
 4776: %%% Utility
 4777: %%%
 4778: 
 4779: %% It is a bit awkward to collect data from different nodes. One way
 4780: %% of doing is to use a named tracer process on each node. Interesting
 4781: %% data is banged to the tracer and when the test is finished data is
 4782: %% collected on some node by sending messages to the tracers. One
 4783: %% cannot do this if the net has been set up to be less than fully
 4784: %% connected. One can also prepare other modules, such as 'global', by
 4785: %% inserting lines like
 4786: %%   trace_message({node(), {at,?LINE}, {tag, message})
 4787: %% where appropriate.
 4788: 
 4789: start_tracer() ->
 4790:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> tracer([]) end),
 4791:     case catch register(my_tracer, Pid) of
 4792:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4793:             ct:fail(re_register_my_tracer);
 4794:         _ ->
 4795:             ok
 4796:     end.
 4797: 
 4798: tracer(L) ->
 4799:     receive 
 4800:         %% {save, Term} ->
 4801:         %%     tracer([{erlang:timestamp(),Term} | L]);
 4802:         {get, From} ->
 4803:             From ! {trace, lists:reverse(L)},
 4804:             tracer([]);
 4805:         stop ->
 4806:             exit(normal);
 4807:         Term ->
 4808:             tracer([{erlang:timestamp(),Term} | L])
 4809:     end.
 4810: 
 4811: stop_tracer() ->
 4812:     trace_message(stop).
 4813: 
 4814: get_trace() ->
 4815:     trace_message({get, self()}),
 4816:     receive {trace, L} ->
 4817:             L
 4818:     end.
 4819: 
 4820: collect_tracers(Nodes) ->
 4821:     Traces0 = [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, get_trace, []) || N <- Nodes],
 4822:     Traces = [L || L <- Traces0, is_list(L)],
 4823:     try begin 
 4824:             Stamped = lists:keysort(1, lists:append(Traces)),
 4825:             NotStamped = [T || {_, T} <- Stamped],
 4826:             {Stamped, NotStamped}
 4827:         end
 4828:     catch _:_ -> {[], []}
 4829:     end.
 4830: 
 4831: trace_message(M) ->
 4832:     case catch my_tracer ! M of
 4833:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4834:             ct:fail(my_tracer_not_registered);
 4835:         _ ->
 4836:             ok
 4837:     end.
 4838: 
 4839: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4840: 
 4841: pi(Item) ->
 4842:     pi(self(), Item).
 4843: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 4844:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 4845:     Val.
 4846:     
 4847: 
 4848: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4849: 
 4850: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 4851: %% The error_logger handler used for OTP-6931.
 4852: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 4853: init(Tester) ->
 4854:     {ok, Tester}.
 4855: 
 4856: handle_event({_, _GL, {_Pid,_String,[{nodeup,fake_node,_}=Msg]}}, Tester) ->
 4857:     Tester ! Msg,
 4858:     {ok, Tester};
 4859: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 4860:     {ok, State}.
 4861: 
 4862: handle_info(_Info, State) ->
 4863:     {ok, State}.
 4864: 
 4865: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 4866: 
 4867: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 4868:     State.
 4869: 
 4870: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4871: %%%
 4872: %%% Keep track of started nodes so we can kill them if test
 4873: %%% cases fail to stop them. This typically happens on test case
 4874: %%% failure with peer nodes, and if left might mess up following
 4875: %%% test-cases.
 4876: %%%
 4877: %%% This can be removed when the suite is converted to use CT_PEER.
 4878: %%% This can however at earliest be made in OTP 25.
 4879: %%%
 4880: 
 4881: node_started(Node) ->
 4882:     _ = global_SUITE_node_tracker ! {node_started, Node},
 4883:     ok.
 4884: 
 4885: node_stopped(Node) ->
 4886:     _ = global_SUITE_node_tracker ! {node_stopped, Node},
 4887:     ok.
 4888: 
 4889: start_node_tracker(Config) ->
 4890:     case whereis(global_SUITE_node_tracker) of
 4891:         undefined ->
 4892:             ok;
 4893:         _ ->
 4894:             try
 4895:                 stop_node_tracker(Config),
 4896:                 ok
 4897:             catch
 4898:                 _:_ ->
 4899:                     ok
 4900:             end
 4901:     end,
 4902:     _ = spawn(fun () ->
 4903:                       _ = register(global_SUITE_node_tracker, self()),
 4904:                       node_tracker_loop(#{})
 4905:               end),
 4906:     ok.
 4907: 
 4908: node_tracker_loop(Nodes) ->
 4909:     receive
 4910:         {node_started, Node} ->
 4911:             node_tracker_loop(Nodes#{Node => alive});
 4912:         {node_stopped, Node} ->
 4913:             node_tracker_loop(Nodes#{Node => stopped});
 4914:         stop ->
 4915:             Fact = try 
 4916:                        test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()
 4917:                    catch _:_ -> 1
 4918:                    end,
 4919:             Tmo = 1000*Fact,
 4920:             lists:foreach(
 4921:               fun (N) ->
 4922:                       case maps:get(N, Nodes) of
 4923:                           stopped ->
 4924:                               ok;
 4925:                           alive ->
 4926:                               ct:pal("WARNING: The node ~p was not "
 4927:                                      "stopped by the test case!", [N])
 4928:                       end,
 4929:                       %% We try to kill every node, even those reported as
 4930:                       %% stopped since they might have failed at stopping...
 4931:                       case rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, [], Tmo) of
 4932:                           {badrpc,nodedown} ->
 4933:                               ok;
 4934:                           {badrpc,timeout} ->
 4935:                               ct:pal("WARNING: Failed to kill node: ~p~n"
 4936:                                      "         Disconnecting it, but it may "
 4937:                                      "still be alive!", [N]),
 4938:                               erlang:disconnect_node(N),
 4939:                               ok;
 4940:                           Unexpected ->
 4941:                               ct:pal("WARNING: Failed to kill node: ~p~n"
 4942:                                      "         Got response: ~p~n"
 4943:                                      "         Disconnecting it, but it may "
 4944:                                      "still be alive!", [N, Unexpected]),
 4945:                               erlang:disconnect_node(N),
 4946:                               ok
 4947:                       end
 4948:               end, maps:keys(Nodes))
 4949:     end.
 4950: 
 4951: stop_node_tracker(Config) ->
 4952:     NTRes = case whereis(global_SUITE_node_tracker) of
 4953:                 undefined ->
 4954:                     {fail, missing_node_tracker};
 4955:                 NT when is_port(NT) ->
 4956:                     NTMon = erlang:monitor(port, NT),
 4957:                     exit(NT, kill),
 4958:                     receive {'DOWN', NT, port, NT, _} -> ok end,
 4959:                     {fail, {port_node_tracker, NT}};
 4960:                 NT when is_pid(NT) ->
 4961:                     NTMon = erlang:monitor(process, NT),
 4962:                     NT ! stop,
 4963:                     receive
 4964:                         {'DOWN', NTMon, process, NT, normal} ->
 4965:                             ok;
 4966:                         {'DOWN', NTMon, process, NT, Reason} ->
 4967:                             {fail, {node_tracker_failed, Reason}}
 4968:                     end
 4969:             end,
 4970:     case NTRes of
 4971:         ok ->
 4972:             ok;
 4973:         NTFailure ->
 4974:             case proplists:get_value(tc_status, Config) of
 4975:                 ok ->
 4976:                     %% Fail test case with info about node tracker...
 4977:                     NTFailure;
 4978:                 _ ->
 4979:                     %% Don't fail due to node tracker...
 4980:                     ct:pal("WARNING: Node tracker failure: ~p", [NTFailure]),
 4981:                     ok
 4982:             end
 4983:     end.
